Gloria has been working with MFP over the course of several loan cycles and, during this time, she has improved her business considerably.  She feels satisfied because she has always shown herself to be responsible in making her loan repayments.  On this occasion, she will buy alfalfa wholesale.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Armando es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien se dedica a la compra y venta animales desde 1991. El con este negocio ha sacado adelante a su familia su esposa y cuatro hijos, brindándole lo mejor posible.
Él invertirá el crédito en la compra de gallinas, cerdo, caballos, vacas…etc. con el fin de mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos Armando is a hardworking and enterprising man who has been buying and selling animals for a living since 1991. With this business, he has helped his family (his wife and four children) to get ahead in life, offering them the best that is possible. 
He will use the loan to buy chickens, pigs, horses, cows, etc, with the goal of improving his business.

loans.use: buy chickens, pigs, horses, cows, etc.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
En el centro poblado menor de Kiteni, distrito de Quillabamba, provincia de La Convención, en el Cusco conocimos al señor Alberto y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba capital de provincia de La Convención, tengo 29 años edad, tengo tres hijos y ahora vivo en la ciudad de Kiteni y donde desarrollo mis actividades económicas que son: Venta de comida y construcción de casas”.   

Alberto es albañil  y trabaja en la Municipalidad de Kiteni en el área construcción de obras, Alberto es una persona responsable y emprendedora que saca adelante a sus hijos, él y su esposa abrieron un negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de comida, ellos atienden desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Hace dos meses que abrieron el pequeña negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, congeladora y otras que faltan en la tienda. El socio Alberto pertenece al banco comunal “Cholo de Oro de Kiteni”.
texts.en:
We met Alberto in the small town of Kiteni, in the district of Quillabamba, province of Convención, in Cusco and he told us:
"I was born in the city of Quillabamba, capital of the province of Convención. I'm 29 years old, I have three kids, and now I live in the city of Kiteni, where I am developing my businesses which are: selling food and building houses."
Alberto is a bricklayer and works in the municipality of Kiteni in construction. Alberto is a responsible and enterprising person who is providing for his children. He and his wife opened a family business selling food and they serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. They opened this little business two months ago and it is going very well. With regards to this opportunity, he requires a loan to buy supplies such as, for example, rice, a freezer, and other things that the business needs. Alberto belongs to the community bank "Cholo de Oro de Kiteni."

loans.use: to buy rice, a freezer, and other things the business needs.

loans.name: Blanca Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora Blanca es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive por las afueras de la parroquia Turi, lugar que es reconocido por ser el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que se puede observar desde allí gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy amable, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
 
Doña Blanca tiene 46 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos de los cuales 5 son casados e independientes, sus tres hijos solteros son de 28, 25 y 17 años de edad, sus hijos mayores de edad trabajan y también estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como carpintero, la casa en la que habita es propia siendo el sacrificio del trabajo conyugal. 

La Señora. Blanca se dedica a la cría de  cuyes y pollos, esta actividad la realiza desde que se ha casado, también se dedica a la agricultura donde siembra hortalizas y vende en un mercado de la ciudad de Cuenca.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para crecer en la cría de estos animales.
 
Su meta es realizar el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the community bank called El Mirador. She lives in the outskirts of the parish of Turi, a place that is well known for its viewpoint or "mirador" from which you can see most of the city of Cuenca. The people of Turi are very nice and they work in commerce, raising livestock, and agriculture. 
Blanca is 46 years old, married and has 8 children, 5 of whom are married and independent. Her three single children are 28, 25, and 17 years old. Her oldest children work and also study, and her youngest child is studying at the high-school in the city. Her husband is a carpenter, and the house they live in is the result of their own work and sacrifice. 
Blanca works raising guinea pigs and chickens. She has been doing this since she got married and she is also a farmer, raising vegetables that she sells in the market in the city of Cuenca. 
She has been a member of the community bank for 3 years and she will use the loan to buy guinea pigs to breed.
Her goals is to build a second story for her house.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es: Elizabeth de 34 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y 3 de sus 5 hijos en las edades de 2 a 19 años, pues los dos mayores son independientes. Elizabeth por iniciativa propia inició el negocio de vender mercancías sin ninguna experiencia y con apoyo en capacitación  de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, se arriesgó a iniciar su propia aventura. Este es su primer credikiva con el cual comprará calzado y una vitrina para exhibir de manera ordenada su mercancía, pues su creciente clientela le gusta observar y de inmediato comprar. Su meta más adelante es comprar en mayor volumen para ganar buenos descuentos y continuar creciendo hasta lograr convertir su microempresa en una fuente de empleo para la comunidad.  El máximo desafío de Elizabeth es lograr apoyar a sus hijos con tal de que se conviertan en personas exitosas y esto es justamente su máximo sueño.
texts.en: 34 year old Elizabeth lives in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and 3 of their 5 children, who are aged from 2 to 19 years old. The two oldest kids are now independent. Elizabeth started her business selling goods on her own initiative and with no experience, and with training and support from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she took the risk and started her own adventure. This is her first Kiva loan, and she will use it to buy shoes and a display case to show her merchandise in an ordered way so that her growing clientele can enjoy looking at things and immediately buy them. Her long term goal is to buy goods in greater volume so she can get good discounts and continue growing the business until she is able to convert her micro-enterprise into a source of employment for the community. The greatest challenge that Elizabeth faces is being able to support her children so that they become successful, and this is her greatest dream.

loans.use: to buy shoes and a display case to show her merchandise in an ordered way.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive por las afueras de la parroquia Turi, lugar que es reconocido por ser el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que se puede observar desde allí gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy amable, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. 

La Señora. María tiene 46 años, es separada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 26, 21, 18 y 4 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en la universidad y su tercer hijo en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María labora en el bar de un colegio de la ciudad, esta actividad la realiza hace 8 años, trabaja medio día de lunes a viernes. Hace 5 años también se dedica a laborar medio día en una fábrica en donde elaboran chocolate.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y  lo va a invertir para comprar productos como papas fritas, tostitos, golosinas, colas, jugos, aguas, etc. para surtir más el bar.
 
Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is a member of the El Mirador community bank.  She lives in Turi parish, a place famous for its sweeping views of Cuenca because you can see much of that beautiful city from there.  The friendly people of Turi make their livings from commerce, livestock-rearing and farming.  

Sra. Maria, 46, is separated and has 4 children: 26-, 21-, 18- and 4-years old, respectively.  Her two oldest children are studying at the university and her next oldest goes to a high school in the city.  She owns her house.  

Dona Maria operates a food stand at a city high school, a business that she has operated for 8 years.  She works half-days from Monday to Friday.  She also works half-days at a chocolate factory, a job that she's had for 5 years.  

This is her third loan and she will use it to buy products to stock her food stand: fried potatoes, chips, cookies, soft drinks, juices, water, etc.

Her aim is to be debt-free.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her catering business.

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esther está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo Arelis de los Ángeles quien vende cosméticos y ropa desde hace cuatro años. Ella vende aproximadamente 3,300 cordobas semanal.

Las otras integrantes son María Esperanza quien realiza enchiladas y tajaditas y Walter José tiene un taller artesanal de calzado.
texts.en:
The “Esther” group is composed of three hard working, enterprising people.  Arelis de los Ángeles who has sold Cosmetics and clothes for the last four years is the group coordinator.  She sells about 3300 cordobas worth weekly.

The other members are María Esperanza, who sells enchiladas and ‘tajaditas’ (fried plantain) and Walter José who has an artisanal shoe shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Elipia

texts.es: Elipia es natural de Chupaca, tiene 59 años, es casada y tiene 04 hijos, quienes ya son independientes, ahora solo  vive con esposo en su casa que es propia. Desde su infancia sus padres forjaron en ella el trabajo esforzado que le ha servido durante toda su vida, tras sus años de matrimonio reforzó este aprendizaje con su esposo labrando los terrenos que ambos heredaron de sus padres. Hoy en día sigue cultivando papa, maíz, habas, arveja, zanahoria entre otros cultivos que  tiene en sus terrenos. Una forma de generarse ingresos adicionales fue mediante su tienda de abarrotes que ya viene funcionando desde hace 20 años. Hace poco implanto en su tienda la venta de verduras y para los niños video juegos como estrategia para que haya más ventas, Elipia esta muy entusiasmada con su negocio y a las actividades agrícolas que realiza,  por lo que ha decidido aumentar su capital de trabajo. Es la primera vez que va solicitar un crédito y fue porque  le recomendaron trabajar con MFP,  considera que los plazos y el monto se ajusta a la necesidad de capital que necesita para crecer y esta muy agradecida por eso. Con el dinero que solicita, le servirá para comprar más mercadería en abarrotes como azúcar, arroz y menestras.
texts.en:
Elipia is from Chupaca.  She is 59 years old, married, and has four children who live independently.  She now lives alone with her husband in their own home.

Since she was a young girl, Elipia's parents instilled in her the need to work hard.  That lesson has served her throughout her life.  After she got married, she reinforced what she had learned alongside her husband, working the land that they both inherited from their parents.  Now Elipia grows potatoes, corn, beans, peas, carrots and other crops on her land.  An additional source of income is the grocery store which she has been running for 20 years now.  A short while ago, she started selling vegetables in her store and also set up video games for the children as a strategy for increasing her sales.  Elipia is very enthusiastic about her grocery store business and the farming that she does.  For this reason, she has decided to increase her working capital.  

This is the first time that Elipia has requested a loan.  She received a recommendation to work with MFP.  She considers that the instalments and the sum of money fit well with the amount of capital she needs to grow her business.  She is very grateful for this.  She will use the money she is requesting to buy more merchandise (groceries) such as sugar, rice and mixed vegetables.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and mixed vegetables to stock her store

loans.name: Rosa Hortencia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive por las afueras de la parroquia Turi, lugar que es reconocido por ser el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que se  puede observar desde allí gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy amable, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
 
Doña Rosa tiene 35 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 9 y 7 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es artesano y labora en hierro forjado. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de su mamá pero independientemente. 

La Señora. Rosa trabaja en su casa en la elaboración de artesanías en cerámica, aprendió este oficio por habilidad y lleva 12 años en él, sus productos los vende a su su selecta clientela, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario especifico.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace un año y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de piezas de cerámica, pinturas, lacas y otros materiales para continuar con su negocio.

Su meta es incrementar y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “El Mirador” communal bank.  She lives in the outskirts of Turi Parish, a place known for being a scenic overlook from where one can see a large portion of the city of Cuenca.  Its residents are very kind, dedicated to commerce, livestock raising and agriculture.

Rosa is 35 years old, married and has two children who are 9 and 7 years of age and attend the local little school.  Her husband is an artisan working in wrought iron.  They do not have a house of their own; they live in her mother’s house but independently.

Rosa works at home making ceramic crafts.  She learned this occupation through ability and has been in it for 12 years.  She sells her items to a select clientele.  She works Sunday to Sunday with no set schedule.

She’s been in the communal bank for a year and she’ll use the loan to buy some ceramic items, paint, lacquer and other materials to continue with her business.  Her goal is to increase business and to grow in it.

loans.use: to buy clay objects, paint, lacquer and other materials.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
En el centro poblado menor de Kiteni, distrito de Quillabamba, provincia de La Convención, en el Cusco conocimos a la señora Rosa Maria y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 33 años edad, tengo dos hijos y ahora vivo en la ciudad de Kiteni y donde desarrollo mi actividad económica que es la venta de comida”. 

Rosa María es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. Hace 6 meses atrás abrió un pequeño restaurante de venta de comida donde sirve desayuno, almuerzo, cena y comidas especiales o extras. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Choclo de Oro de Kiteni” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar una congeladora. Su sueño de Rosa María es convertirse en una empresaria y quiere abrir un restaurante turístico.
texts.en:
In the lower town center of Kiteni, district of Quillabamba, province of La Convencion, in Cusco, we meet Mrs. Rosa Maria and she tells us:

"I was born in the city of Quillabamba. I am 33, I have two children, and I now live in the city of Kiteni where I have my business selling food".

Rosa Maria is a hard-working and enterprising woman who gets her family ahead. Six months ago she opened a small restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch, dinner and extra or special meals. She belongs to the Asociacion Arariwa's "Choclo de Oro de Kiteni" communal bank. She currently needs a loan to purchase a freezer. Her dream is to become a businesswoman, and she wants to open a tourist restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 32 years old and lives with her partner. Her occupation is working for the Ministry of Health in Peru. She is asking for a $500 loan in order to make general improvements to her house. A majority of the interior of her house is very old. Therefore, Maria would like to purchase new furniture and paint the inside of her house. She is very proud of her home and is always striving to make it better. Maria is committed to making the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and paint for her house

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
En el centro poblado menor de Kiteni, distrito de Quillabamba, provincia de La Convención, en el Cusco, conocimos al señor Benigno y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Cusco, tengo 44 años edad, tengo seis hijos y ahora vivo en la ciudad de Kocineri – Kumpire a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Kiteni y donde desarrollo mi actividad económica que es la construcción de casas, agricultura y crianza de animales menores”. 

Benigno es una persona emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a la construcción de casas y le ha ido muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos. Benigno y su esposa pertenecen al banco comunal “Choclo de Oro de Kiteni” de la Asociación Arariwa. El sueño de Benigno es convertirse en una empresario y ser distribuidor mayorista de pollos y desea trabajar por las zonas de Ivochote, Kimbiri, Pichari, etc.
texts.en:
In the minor town center of Kiteni, Quillabamba district, La Convencion province, in Cusco, we meet Mr Benigno and he tells us:

"I was born in the city of Cusco. I am 44, I have 6 children, and I now live in the city of Kocineri - Kumpire, 10 minutes from the city of Kiteni, where I have my businesses: building houses, agriculture, and raising small animals".

Benigno is an enterprising person who gets his family ahead. For 10 years he has built houses and it has gone very well for him. He currently needs a loan to purchase chickens. Benigno and his wife belong to the  Asociacion Arariwa's "Choclo de Oro de Kiteni" communal bank. Benigno's dream is to be a businessman and a wholesale chicken distributor. He wants to distribute to the Ivochote, Kimbiri, and Pichari zones, among others.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Ana Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora ella tiene de trabajar con Adim alrededor de 12 créditos en los cuales ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, laboriosa y dedicada. Ella  tiene un modesto taller de muebles el cual inicio hace 10 años junto a su esposo.
Ana Rosa con el crédito compra mercadería para realizar camas, sillas, roperos, sillas abuela (mecedoras), sillones…etc.
texts.en:
Mrs Ana Rosa is a hard-working and enterprising woman. She has had around 12 loans from ADIM, and has proven to be a responsible, hard-working and dedicated person. She has a small furniture workshop where she has made furniture for 10 years with her husband.
Ana Rosa will use this loan to make beds, chairs, wardrobes, rocking chairs, armchairs...etc.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails...etc..

loans.name: La Ponderosa (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Ponderosa está formado por 8 mujeres y 3 hombres quienes son amigos y conocidos, laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten ayudar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias. Nuestros socios viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que en 1999 fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, tiene una gran belleza cultural, natural y arquitectónica, su gente es muy amable y siempre mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Señora. María Margarita, vive por el sector de Monay, tiene 42 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 21 y 17 años de edad quienes son  casados e independientes. Nuestra socia no tiene casa propia y vive arrendando.
 
Doña María Margarita se dedica a la crianza de ganado, esta actividad  la realiza hace mucho tiempo, con la leche que obtiene de su ganado realiza quesillo y lo vende en la ciudad de Cuenca.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de un ternero.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The “La Ponderosa” communal bank is made up of eight women and three men, all good friends who know each other well.  They each work daily in their own different businesses which allow each of them to help their families financially.  Our members live in Cuenca, a city that was named to be one of the fathers of human culture in 1999.  It has a beautiful architecture, natural surroundings, and culture.  Its people are very friendly and maintain their culture and traditions.

María Margarita is one of the group’s members.  She is 42 years old, a widow, and lives in the Monay sector.  She has two children, ages 17 and 21, both of who are married and on their own.  She lives in a rented home.

María Margarita raises livestock and has been doing this for a long time.  She uses the milk to make cottage cheese which she sells in Cuenca.

This will be her second loan through the communal bank and she will invest the money in a plot of land.  Someday she would like to have a home of her own.

loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phones and inventory.

loans.name: Mujeres Soñadoras (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Soñadoras está formado por 6 mujeres y 3 hombres quienes viven diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una gran belleza natural y cultural, su gente son personas amables y cordiales, esta ciudad también tiene una gran variedad de platos típicos que cautivan el paladar de propios y extraños. Nuestros socios son personas muy trabajadoras que laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y salir adelante junto a sus familias. 

Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. María Cruz, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 60 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad y casados. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Nuestra socia desde muy joven se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes y conejos, a los que los vende en la ciudad. También se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para su consumo. Hace 4 años se dedica a la recolección de chatarra.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es tener más animales para la crianza.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Soñadoras” (Women Dreamers) communal bank is composed of six women and three men who live in various places in the city of Cuenca, a city with much natural and cultural beauty.  Its residents are kind and courteous people.  This city also has a wide variety of traditional dishes that captivate the taste buds of locals and foreigners alike.  Our members are very hard working people who are engaged in a variety of occupations that allow them to meet household expenses and to get ahead with their families.

One of the group members is María Cruz.  She lives in Cuenca and is 60 years old.  She’s a widow and has five children who are all adults and married.  She does not have a house of her own; she rents.

Our member has raised chickens, guinea pigs and rabbits since she was a young girl that she sells in the city.  She also farms and what she grows is for her own consumption.  She’s also been collecting scrap for four years.

This is the second loan she’s had in the communal bank and she will use it to buy guinea pigs and their feed.  Her goal is to have more animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
Diana vive en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla a 5 kilómetros del aeropuerto de la ciudad, contiguo a las poblaciones de Soledad, Sabanagrande y Santo Tomás, caracterizado por una  composición social muy especial, debido a que en sus habitantes encontramos una mezcla gente de todo el país,  que llega a trabajar de manera independiente mediante un negocio o  en El Parque Industrial Malambo S.A. -PIMSA- condominio industrial privado de completa infraestructura de servicios, orientados a garantizar reducciones en los costos a las empresas que se ubiquen en sus instalaciones y que tienen garantizada la disponibilidad suficiente de mano de obra a las empresas de la zona.
En este dinàmico ambiente, Diana dese hace 2 años emprendiò su aventura de negocios, con un pequeño préstamo informal de alto costo, con el que compró sus primeras mercancias y continuó durante un tiempo,  prestando y pagando intereses onerosos diariamente en un solo mes. Una vez cumplida esta obligacion, decidió no continuar perdiendo mas dinero y como   habia construído una una clientela de mas de 100 personas, se arriesgó a continuar  con su propio esfuerzo y sin prestar a tan alto costo. Pocoa poco ha ido recuperandose, pero quiere encontrar la forma de crecer mas ràpido y lograr mayor sostenibilidad; esta es la razòn por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprarà 5 plateras, 10 calderos, 10 sillas 20 platos, vasos, cubiertos, tanques de agua y articulos plàsticos, que tiene encargados y que presentan una buena rotaciòn. Con credikiva espera incrementar las ventas y mantener un buen inventario, para satisfacer las demandas de su cuidada clientela. Su sueño al lado de su conyuge, es lograr, cada dia mas bienestar para sus dos hijos, hoy en las eades de 2 y 8 años respectivamente. Mientras esto ocurre, Diana dia a dia se pasea, impulsando su coche de dos ruedas por todo el municipio, atendiendo a sus clientes y consiguiendo nuevos y rentables compradores para hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Diana lives in the town of Malambo in Barranquilla’s metropolitan area five kilometers from the city’s airport adjacent to the towns of Soledad, Sabanagrande and Santo Tomás and noted for having a very special social composition because among its residents we can find a mixture of people for all over the country who come to work independently either in a business or at the Parque Industrial Malambo, S.A. - PIMSA, a private industrial condominium with complete infrastructure of services aimed at reducing costs for firms that locate in its installations and that provide guaranteed staffing for firms in the zone.

In this dynamic environment, Diana started a business adventure two years ago with a small informal, high-cost loan that she used to buy her initial merchandise.  She started out like that and continued for a time borrowing and paying onerous interest rates daily in a single month.  Once she paid it back she decided not to borrow any more money and since she had managed to secure a clientele of over 100 people, she dared to continue with her own efforts but not borrowing at such a high cost.

She’s been gradually recovering but she’d like to find a way to grow more quickly and to attain better sustainability.  This is why she’s calling on Kiva, the first loan she’s getting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy 5 cutlery trays, 10 cauldrons, 10 chairs, 20 plates, drinking glasses, cutlery, water tanks and plastic items that she has orders for and that sell quickly.

She hopes to increase sales and maintain a good inventory with her Kiva loan to meet the demand of her clientele that she wants to please.  Her dream, alongside her spouse, is to improve each day the wellbeing of their two children who are today 2 and 8 years of age respectively.

While this occurs, Diana spends each day pushing her two-wheeled cart throughout the town’s streets tending to her customers and winning over new and profitable ones to make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy plasticware.

loans.name: Sambi Ternak Group

texts.en: Like many Balinese women, Luh and the other members of the Sambi Ternak group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Luh hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs. Luh will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months to use as pork.  With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing the income of her husband.  Ultimately, Luh hopes that the increased income will enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 1 year. She earns more income from food vending and welding shop. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wants to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stationery items as well as foodstuffs and cosmetics.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Cristita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. 

Cristita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business of food production and vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store, like spices, milk, groceries, etc.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 7 years. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sovanna

texts.en: Sovanna, 41 years old, is a fish paste seller. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $7 per day. She has five children. Three of the children are studying and two more are working as MPAs with $2 income per day. Every month she has to spend $90 on food, $7 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work. She wants to repair her house when she has enough money, and extend her career by making more fish paste to sell. For her children, she will help them to study and at least finish secondary school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. 

Lucia has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Lucia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Maricel has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & candies.

Maricel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & candies

loans.name: Kimchhouen

texts.en: Kimchhouen, 32 year old, is a spa supervisor.  Her husband is a Tok Tok driver. Their income is $13 per day. She has one child and he is four years old. Every month she has to spend $75 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to use to travel to work. She likes her job and works hard to get a bonus and a high salary.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to travel to work

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok is the mother of three children and resides in Siem Reap Province. To create a good living standard, Sok started a business of selling souvenir materials near Ankor Wat temple. Because many guests come to visit the temple, it is an opportunity for her to earn more benefits. Hence, she and her husband want to increase their supply of souvenir materials. Sok would like to ask for $900 to support that purchase. With her selling abilities, she could  gain $7 per day with her husband. It is suitable for them to borrow this loan.

loans.use: to buy additional souvenir materials for selling.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Sophorn is a housewife. Her husband is a chief of construction workers with $10 per day for his income. She has two children who are 11 and 6 years old.  Every month she has to spend $75 on food, $10 on transportation, $7 on electricity and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her sister to use to travel to work. Before, she was a food seller but she quit because she was busy helping to cook for her husband’s workers at home. She plans to sell food again when she is free from helping her husband so that she can make additional income to help her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her sister to travel to work

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Juanita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages & breads. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Juanita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Juanita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is working in a restaurant. Her husband is an electric mechanic; their income is $10 per day. She has two children, 5 and 1 year old. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $11 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 for repairing her house. Her house is getting flooded, so she needs to repair it; otherwise, she could not have a proper place to stay with her family. Before her family used to sell fish, but she could earn so little income with her husband, she tried to find another job to do. Her current job can make quite a good income. In the future, she wants to get a small shop to sell grocery goods at home.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a farmer who lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She is married and has four children.

Rebecca and her husband are both farmers. They both till their land where they grow rice crops. Rebecca works hard to help support her family.

Rebecca requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have an abundant harvest. Rebecca also hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Lieum

texts.en:
Lieum, 44 year old, is a basket seller. Her husband is a car driver, and their income is $10 per day. She has four children; three are studying, and the other one is a security guard with an income of $2 per day. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $20 on electricity, $50 on school fees and $30 on transportation. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy baskets to sell near her village. Her family has been doing this business for a long time and they've been successful, so she wants to extend it to sell more kinds of baskets when she has enough money to do it.

loans.use: To buy baskets to sell near her village.

loans.name: Honelyn

texts.en:
Honelyn is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Honelyn has a retail shop that sells frozen foods like dressed chicken & hotdogs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy an additional stock of frozen foods.

Honelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Honelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods

loans.name: Thavouen

texts.en: Thavouen, 38 years old, is a food seller. Her husband is an animal seller. Their income is $11 per day. They have three children, all of whom are studying.  Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $40 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy male pigs for others who need male pigs for their female pigs to get babies. With this career, she can get some more income. In the future, she wants to enlarge her food shop to be bigger than now. For her children, she will support them to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a male pig

loans.name: Gulkan's Group

texts.en:
Gulkan, 54, is the leader of this group. She resides in the warm southern town of Kadamjai. Gulkan’s husband is a worker in a local chemical plant, while she is a medical worker. She devotes all of her life to medicine and saving human lives. On summer vacations, Gulkan runs a small business selling fruits and vegetables that she grows in the orchard. The assortment is wide from apples to carrots. All three of Gulkan’s grown children help her to manage the garden and distribute the products. The initial capital was 5 000 soms and brings a monthly profit of 2 000 soms now. Gulkan plans to stay involved in this trade for the whole summer and start livestock breeding later. In order to do this, she asks Kiva lenders for financial assistance. The funds from loan will be spent on the purchase of two heads of livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Annaliza has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & breads. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Annaliza is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Annaliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey, 41 year old, is a vegetable seller. Her husband is a carpenter. Their income is $11 per day. She has six children. Four of the children are studying and the other two are working with $3 per day for their income. Every month she has to spend $66 on food, $8 on electricity, $25 on rent, $40 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a decorative wood machine for her husband's career. If he has his own machine, it will help him to gain more benefits and he won't have to spend his money to find another machine to use. With her profits, she would like to repair her house to be better than now and to be able to send her children to study at the university.

loans.use: To buy a decorative wood machine for her husband's career

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Josephine has a retail shop that sells firewood. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of firewood to sell.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Zoya's Group

texts.en:
According to top designers of Kyrgyztan, the textile industry of the country has an extreme need for human resources. There are many designers, who are generators of ideas and low-level seamstresses, who execute the intended idea. However, very often both sides face misunderstandings which are caused by the absence of a middle linkage between them. The industry is in need of mid-level employees who would interpret top designers' ideas into small tasks for seamstresses. 

Zoya, 53, is the leader of this group. She is one of those linkage employees who are critically important for any business. Zoya is married and has been providing private sewing and designing services for two years. She acquired these skills while working for a local fashion house. Her business was started with the purchase of a sewing machine for 10,000 soms. This equipment is Zoya's main asset and helps create hundreds of looks. A monthly profit is around 6,000 soms (~$135); however, a very small part of it is saved for the purchase of additional equipment. Zoya would like to use the loan for the purchase of a new type of sewing machine that would definitely improve the quality of her clothing. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Yort

texts.en: Yort, 47 year old, sells soft drinks and sugar cane. She is a single mother who stays with one son. He is a motorbike repairer with an income of $4 per day. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $7 on electricity, $15 on rent, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy motorbike stuff for her son’s motorbike repair shop to serve his customers. For her future, she wants to extend her son's career to get more customers.

loans.use: To buy motorbike stuff for her son's new career

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Arlyn has a retail shop that sells fish like tamban, kotob & tabas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Arlyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a skillful lady who does sewing for her neighboring clients. She receives regular orders and makes good profits every month from her skills. She is 28 years old and has five children: two sons and three daughters. Four of her children are getting their education while her youngest child is not of school-going age yet. 

Her husband is an employee in the factory. His income is not enough for the whole family. That’s why Rukhsana adopted the profession of sewing clothes. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her business of sewing. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to finish her orders on time and earn better profits. She is very experienced in her work and has been operating her business for the past five years. She is confident that an investment will bring even better profits to her and help her family to live a better financial life. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura, 33, is the leader of this group. She is married and has three children, the youngest of whom is only a year old. While she takes care of her children, her husband drives a cab and brings in a monthly income of 10,000 soms. Both of them understand the importance of financial investment. However according to Ainura, access to finance is not the only thing to grow a business. They pay the same attention to customer satisfaction too. After some time, Ainura plans to get back to her previous business, a shop that they opened three years ago. The monthly income of the family reaches 10,000 soms. The loan is requested in order to buy automobile parts for her husband’s cab. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts for her husband's cab

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jenny has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Jenny is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jenny hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Samporn

texts.en: Samporn sells sweets. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $12 per day. She has one child who is one year old. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $15 on rent, $10 on electricity, and $25 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy materials to make sweets to sell. She has been doing this career for a long time so she has a lot of customers to buy her sweets. She plans to extend her sweet shop when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make sweets

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is married with five children. Jaime is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for 10 years. 

Jaime is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides to use in his farming. Jaime hopes this loan will grow his operation. Jaime earned PHP 25,000 in his previous harvest last April. 

In the future, Jaime hopes to generate more income to make his family more economically stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 44 years old and married with five children. The oldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is four.

Merlinda is a farmer working in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 16 years. According to Merlinda, she can earn as much as 15,000 PHP per month from farming.

Merlinda is requesting a loan to purchase rice seeds, herbicides and fertilizers. She hopes to have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara, 54, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of the small village of Bokonbaevo. Gulnara is a mother of two kids who are in middle school. She has been raising and reselling cattle for 15 years now and very often sends cattle to the highlands in summer. The whole summer, a hired shepherd looks after the cattle carefully. Her initial investment was about 20 000 soms. Gulnara asks for a loan that will be used for the payment of a shepherd's services. “Investment in business will hopefully generate more profit that I would like to spend on finishing the construction of my house”, Gulnara says.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for a shepherd's services

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai, 51 year old, is a fish seller. She is a single mother with two children who are 25 and 17 years old. Both of them are working with $4 per day for their income. Every month she has to spend $75 on food, $7 on electricity, $31 on rent, $40 on transportation, and $16 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her children to use to travel to work. Without a motorbike, her children will not come home often because they have to spend a lot of money on transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work

loans.name: Lanie Marie

texts.en:
Lanie Marie is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Lanie Marie has an internet cafe shop that provides encoding & online games. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the utilities for the computer services.

Lanie Marie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lanie Marie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the utilities for computer services

loans.name: Savouen

texts.en: Savouen, 43 year old, is selling food in the market. Her income is $8 per day. She is a single mother with four children. Two of the children are studying and the other two are working with an income of $2 per day. Every month she has to spend $40 on food, $30 on school fees, $30 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would to request a loan of $500 to buy construction materials to build a small shop for her son to do car polishing. In the future, she would like to send the rest of her children to study at the university so that they can have a good job to do.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a polishing shop for her son

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a 38-year-old man who is married and lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He has four school-aged children. He makes a living by buying empty bottles or used materials suitable for recycling and sends them to companies for a good price. He is helping our environment minimize waste items that are not properly disposed of. He has been doing this good activity for five years already and gets a monthly income of PHP 6,440 (~$160). 

Rolando has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to add more capital for buying empty bottles or used materials suitable for recycling. He has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. He hopes to sustain his business for long, long years, find good buyers and earn more income from it.

loans.use: to buy more empty bottles and used materials for recycling.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 48-year-old woman, married and living in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two grown children. She is engaged in a cross-stitching business activity to earn a living. She has been doing it for three years. A monthly income of approximately PHP 3,000 (~$75) is generated from this activity.  

She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 at GDMPC to buy materials needed for cross-stitch designing or crafting. Evelyn has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. She plans for more beautiful designs to sell in order to get more orders to increase her usual income.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for cross stitch designing.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. He has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 5 years.

He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, candies and breads. Gilbert is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies and breads.

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.en:
Hipolita is a 40-year-old woman, married, and residing in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two school-age children with her. 

She is selling fish in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She earns a total of PHP 4,820 a month from this venture. Hipolita has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 at GDMPC to acquire more fish varieties to sell in the communities nearby. She hopes to have a fish vending stall in the marketplace and earn more profit in the future.

loans.use: to acquire more fish varieties to sell in the communities nearby

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a 60-year-old man, married, and lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He has two good children with him. He owns and operates a sari-sari store to earn a living. He generates a total of PHP 20,000 a month from the store activity. His business is good enough that he has managed to run the business for ten successful years already. 

Antonio has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional grocery stocks, school and office supplies to sell. He has been a member of GDMPC for three years. He hopes to expand the managed store and make a good income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stocks, school and office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Bayarsanaa

texts.en: Bayarsanaa lives with his wife and two daughters, age 5 and 7, in a ger (a Mongolian yurt). They live in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His older daughter goes to a secondary school. He manages a shoe-making business with the help of his wife. They started their business in 2007 and gained much experience. At first they had only one sewing machine in their possession. Since then they have been able to stabilize and expand their business. Now they employ four more workers and are planning to employ more in the future. All their customers are happy with their service and like to buy shoes regularly. He says, "We want to renew and buy more equipment in order to expand our business operation. Then we can have an opportunity to employ more people." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials to make shoes.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is a 43 year old woman, married and a residence of Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two children with her. She engaged in a service-based activity to earn a living for one year already. She gets a total of PHP 5,000 a month from this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 at GDMPC to pay for a motorcycle repair to keep it in good running condition and sustain the living. Tessie has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She hopes to improve the business and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle repair to keep it in good running condition.

loans.name: Saidrahmon

texts.en:
Saidrahmon is a hard-working man. He is married and the father of four children. Saidrahmon tries to maintain good living conditions for his family; toward this end, he engages in selling foods such as sugar, oil, pasta and more. He trades at the central local market in the Shahrituz region. Saidrahmon wants to expand his business and increase his working capital in order to improve his family's standard of living. That’s why he has requested a loan of 8,500 TJS.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Compone, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila; la socia tiene 35 años; la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, de 18, 17 y 8 años de edad;  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia vende leche fresca, también queso que son los derivados de sus vacas lecheras, la socia tiene vacas lecheras y toros, ella cría las vacas las engorda y vende, al igual que vende los derivados de estas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de 1 vaca ternera y 1 toro tierno para aumentar el número de sus ganados vacunos.

 La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the "Mujeres en Acción" community bank which is located in Compone district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Lucila is 35 years old, married, and has three children aged 18, 17 and 8.  Her business is selling products retail.  She sells fresh milk and also cheese from her dairy cows.  She keeps dairy cows and bulls.  Lucila raises the cows, fattens them and sells them.  She also sells the dairy products she gets from them.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying 1 young cow and 1 young bull to increase the number of cattle she has.

Lucila is very happy and grateful for the support that she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy 1 calf (cow) and 1 calf (bull) to increase her number of cattle

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Since 2000, Mrs. Sorn has been living in Siem Reap province of Cambodia with her family of four, including two children. She and her husband, in trying to find a good job, started fish selling. Mrs. Sorn sells fish in a market near her house.

Her husband catches fish to give his wife for sale at the market. Both of them are able to make a profit of $6 per day. Mrs. Sorn would like to borrow some money to improve the business. She is requesting this loan of $500 to repair her old house, which is broken.

loans.use: to repair her old house

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a 52-year-old married woman who lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has one child.. She sells fruit salad in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years and earns a monthly income of PHP 5,000. 

Jessie has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional materials for her fruit salad making. She has been with GDMPC for one year. She looks forward to owning a stall for snack vending in the market and earning more income for living.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for fruit salad

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
At the very young age of 20, Erwin engaged in planting and harvesting rice for future sale. He has been doing this for over a year. As a farmer working in the Philippines, he earns the average of 60,000 PHP (~$1410) every harvest season. He plants and harvests rice twice a year, every April and November.

Erwin is asking for a loan to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides for his farming to improve his crop production. In the future, he hopes to strengthen his business and generate more income from farming to maintain economic stability.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a 64-year-old married woman who lives in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed to have five grown children living with her. She engaged in a nipa-making business making palm thatch for construction to earn a living. Hard-working as she is, Josefa has been in the business for 15 years. She earns a total of PHP 1,500 a month from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 from GDMPC to purchase materials needed in her nipa-making business. Josefa has been a member of GDMPC for two years. She hopes to gain more income in the future and produce more of materials to distribute in the market.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in her nipa-making business

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has one school-aged child at this time. She buys and sells various products to earn a living. She has been working in the business for three years. Liberty generates a monthly income of PHP 2,000 from this job. 

Liberty has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 at GDMPC to purchase various products such as cloths, bags, laundry soaps, slippers, kitchen wares and more to sell in the local community. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. Liberty hopes to acquire more products to sell in the local community and have a space for the business in town.

loans.use: to purchase various products to sell such as cloths, bags, laundry soaps, slippers, kitchenware and more

loans.name: Maripa's Group

texts.en:
Maripa is the leader of this group. She is 33 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she is bringing up their son, 14, who studies at school. In order to earn money to help the family budget, Maripa cultivates agricultural products, potatoes and wheat mostly, and her husband is engaged in cattle breeding. In this way the family makes money to meet their daily needs. Maripa applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing cattle. She hopes that the loan will help her husband to raise the profits gained from reselling cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Janyl's Group

texts.en:
Janyl, 63, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in the Isykul region. Together with her husband she has raised five children, all of whom are married and employed. 

Eleven years ago, with an initial investment of 8,000 soms, Janyl started to breed livestock. She resells livestock at a higher price after fattening them. In this way she earns about 10,000 soms (~$226) per month. This profit makes it possible to improve the family’s living conditions. 

Janyl applied for the loan because she needs money to increase the number of livestock. The purpose of the loan is to purchase three livestock animals. In the future Janyl wants to expand her business, and with the profits gained she wishes to build a new big house for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Tserennadmid

texts.en:
Tserennadmid lives with her husband and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Sansar district of Ulaanbaatar city. Her two children, age 1 and 6, stay home with their nanny while her husband works as an operator at a private company. 

She manages a bottle trading business in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business in 2003 and has been able to expand her business. With eight years of operating her business, she has gained much experience and built a good relationship, both with her partners and her suppliers. She contributes all her business earnings for her family's use. She is an honest and diligent woman who is planning to continue her business in the future. She says, "Since my business operation I have been able to improve my family's living conditions." 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more bottles for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Vung

texts.en: Mrs. Vung has resided permanently in Siem Reap Province for a long time and lives there happily with her family. She and her husband have given birth to three kids. To improve their family living situation, they try to find a better job than others and have decided to make a business planting crops. Taking time from their business, her husband also catches fish around the lake, pond and river. With the talent skill for these jobs, Mrs. Vung and her husband could earn a profit of $10 per day. They wish to borrow a loan in the amount of $500 for the purpose of planting potato seeds.

loans.use: to plant potato seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Lourdeliza

texts.en:
Lourdeliza is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. She has a food shop that sells snacks like rice and cassava cakes. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Lourdeliza is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a retail shop that sells snacks, breads and biscuits. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Eufemia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mogina

texts.en:
Mogina is 51 years old and is a married woman with 6 children. Her eldest child is 25 years old, and the youngest is 9. 

She is a farmer. She and her husband own and till land in Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. Rice is the main crop that they grow and sell. She does her best to support her family and send her children to school.

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and fuel for the tractor. Mogina is hopeful that this loan will help them achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel for the tractor.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

She has a tailor shop that provides the repair and sewing of school and office uniforms. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy supplies like cloth and thread.

Anecita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies like cloth and thread.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
44-year-old Connie is a married woman with 3 children. Her children are 21, 17 and 13 years old. Her husband is a farmer.

Connie is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land in the town of Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Connie works hard to make their farm productive. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and fuel for the tractor they use at the farm.

In the future, she hopes for their business to be stable. She also hopes for her children to finish college and be successful in their own fields.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and fuel for the tractor.

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 4 years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy a stock of dried fish to sell. Mansueta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of dried fish to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 29 years old and married with 4 children, aged 9 to 3 years old, living in a permanent residential house in Karuguuza, Uganda. For 3 years, John has been operating a retail shop business, and from it he has been able to buy land. He faces the challenge of the high rate of inflation, but he hopes to expand his business to a wholesale status. John intends to use the loan to buy sugar, kerosene and soap for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, kerosene and soap for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 43-year-old married man with 7 children between the ages of 22 and 5 years, living in Karuguuza, Uganda. He lives in his own house where he stays with 6 people, and his desire is to educate his children up to university. 

For 15 years, Joseph has been operating a retail shop business, and from this business he has been able to build a house for the family. He faces the challenge of the high rate of inflation but hopes to make it a wholesale shop. Joseph needs a loan to buy soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: To buy soap, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Arnelyn

texts.en:
Arnelyn is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. She has a shop that sells generic medicines. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of generic medicines.

Arnelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of generic medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cassava flour.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 58-year-old married woman with 6 children. The oldest child is 38 years old and the youngest is 21.

Teresita earns a living through farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She earns about 10,000 PHP per month (~$250) from farming. She works hard to support her family and send her younger children to school.

She has requested this loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides. Teresita hopes for her business to be a way to uplift her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
64-year-old Oliva lives in the town of Santa Josefa, Agusan Del Sur, with her family. She has 5 adult children.

Oliva started her farming business 6 years ago. She grows rice crops and then sells her harvest at her town's market. Oliva is also a palm oil harvester. She earns about 6,000 PHP (~$150) per month from her farming and harvesting oil.

She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. This loan will help her keep her crops healthy.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sari Maju Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang lives in Melaya, West Bali. She is married and has two children aged 14 and 9. Her younger son is in the fourth year of elementary school and her older son is in the second year of junior high school. Her husband works as a Farmer. Though Ni Komang often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family's income. She has been raising pigs for five years. 

Ni Komang is the head of the S. Maju group, which is made up of 14 neighbors from the same village. This is the group's first loan with MUK. With the 1,500,000 Indonesian Rupiah (IDR) that Ni Komang receives, she will purchase two piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs. With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her piggery, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop that sells vegetables like squash and string beans. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell. Elvie has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gleen

texts.en: Gleen, 42-year-old married father of nine children, lives in the Philippines where, for the last five years, he has owned and operated a meat shop selling meat  pork and chicken. A member of HSPFI since 2009, he has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy pigs to be butchered. In the future, Gleen hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs to be butchered.

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.en:
Cayetano, 58 years old and married, is a farmer who tills land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. With parents who were farmers, Cayetano has been growing rice for a long time now and also raises pigs for fattening and sale in his backyard.

Due to current financial constraints, Cayetano is requesting this loan to purchase additional rice seeds, fertilizers, and pigs. The loan will help Cayetano continue his businesses and earn more for his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pigs.

loans.name: Niza

texts.en: Niza, a 28-year-old married mother of three children, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a retail shop selling vegetables such as string beans and tomatoes for two years. A new member of HSPFI, Niza has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more vegetables to sell, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Saddam
