To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy grocery items and other products for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Ma.Fe dreams to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery products and personal items for her general store

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Esther has operated a farm products sales business for the past ten years, selling her wares in retail to her neighbours and passers-by. Eunice also is engaged in farming, which provides a secondary source of income. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak and pests on her farm. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Eunice and her husband have three children, all of whom attend school. They own and live in a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Their greatest monthly expense is medical bills.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan she has requested, Esther wants to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. She decided to join Yehu in order to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: La Grace De Dieu  Pk10 Group

texts.fr: LA GRACE DE DIEU  PK10 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Conforte. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe LA GRACE DE DIEU  PK10 sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.  Conforte est âgée de 32 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Conforte est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés, et vivant avec elle. Conforte n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Conforte mène comme activité la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine. Conforte exerce cette activité depuis près de dix ans, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Conforte s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Conforte et aux autres membres du groupe LA GRACE DE DIEU  PK10, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
LA GRACE DE DIEU (God's Grace) PK10 is a group made up of three persons; their president (the woman with her hand raised) is named Conforte. The members of the group live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. In order to grow their working capital, this LA GRACE DE DIEU  PK10 group is requesting their second loan from ALIDé.  

Conforte, 32, no longer lives with her husband. She is the mother of two children, both enrolled in school and living with her. Conforte was never able to go to school. To support herself and her children, she sells kitchen utensils. She has been in this business for almost 10 years and it allows her to cover the various living expenses of her family. She buys her products in one of the biggest markets in  Bénin. 

This second loan will certainly permit Conforte and the other members of her group, LA GRACE DE DIEU  PK10, to raise the level of their businesses and grow their clientele and their income.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hard-working 61-year-old businesswoman. She and her husband have two children. For the last three years, Virginia has been providing for her family with the income she earns from offering tailoring services. She also earns extra income from operating a cereals shop. In the next five years, she plans to increase her customer base so that she is able to realize her dream of expanding her enterprise.
 
She is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy material for sewing as well as cereals to offer for sale in her shop. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to add stock to her enterprises from the loans advanced to her.

loans.use: to buy material for sewing as well as cereals to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, age 30 and unmarried, runs a bakery to earn a living. He has been operating the business for one year and employs one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has gained a lot of business knowledge. This has helped him to run his business well. He hopes to expand his business and employ more people.

Felix has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy baking powder, cooking fat, and trays.

loans.use: To buy baking powder, cooking fat, and trays for his bakery business

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the purchase of chicken feed.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 15,000, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed to start a poultry business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed to start a poultry business

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
Юрий разведен. Он малый предприниматель из Запорожья. Так как Запорожье в основном промышленный город, большинство людей здесь работают или на заводах или в торговле. Юрий – один из последних. Он занимается оптовой и розничной торговлей продуктами: яйцами, кондитерскими изделиями и т.д. Юрий имеет большой опыт работы и несколько своих торговых мест. Он занимается этим бизнесом уже около 9 лет. Юрий вложил в товар около 35.000 гривен. Его ежемесячный доход составляет около 11.000 гривен.  

Юрий планирует использовать кредит в 18.000 гривен с целью закупки большим оптом кондитерских изделий в Полтаве. Получив дополнительную прибыль, Юрий хотел бы запустить в работу новый прилавок, который почти готов к началу работы.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Yuriy is divorced.  He is a small entrepreneur from Zaporozhye.  Because Zaporozhye is primarily an industrial city, the majority of people here either work at factories or in retail.  Yuriy is one of the latter.  He is involved in wholesale and retail sales of food products, such as eggs, confectionery goods, etc.  Yuriy has extensive experience in this work and owns several retail outlet.  He has been involved in this business for almost nine years.  Yuriy invested about 35,000 hryvnia into the merchandise.  His monthly income amounts to approximately 11,000 hryvnia.  Yuriy plans to use the loan of 18,000 hryvnia to purchase a large set of confectionery goods in Poltava.  Having received the additional profit, Yuriy wants to put a new counter into production, which is almost ready to begin working.

loans.use: to purchase a large set of confectionary goods in Poltava

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a tailoring business. Her neighbors are her potential customers. She also operates a retail shop business, which contributes to her other source of income. Mary dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase cloth material for tailoring and bundles of wheat flour and maize flour for her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth material for tailoring and bundles of wheat flour and maize flour for her retail shop.

loans.name: Gennadiy

texts.ru:
Геннадий живет и работает в Мелитополе. Он торгует сладкой ватой, конфетами, разными кондитерскими изделиями, минеральной водой, напитками и прочим в центральном городском парке своего города. В его маленьком киоске всегда можно увидеть широкий ассортимент товара и постоянных покупателей. Геннадий отличается предприимчивостью и умением правильно вести свой бизнес. Он занимается этой мелкой торговлей уже 16 лет. Его доход составляет 8.500 гривен. 

Сумму в 20.000 гривен Геннадий хотел бы вложить в закупку дополнительного ассортимента продуктовых товаров, а именно конфет, печенья, сока и мороженного. За счет увеличения ассортимента товара Геннадий планирует получить дополнительную прибыль и приобрести холодильную камеру. Одной из целей Геннадия является расширить свой бизнес и, по возможности, открыть еще одну точку. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Gennadiy lives and works in Melitopol.  He sells cotton candy, candy, various confectionery goods, mineral water, drinks and other products at the city central park in his own town.  One can always see a wide assortment of products and loyal customers in his small food store.  Gennadiy stands out through his entrepreneurship and ability to steer his business well.  He has been involved in such retail sales for sixteen years.  His income amounts to 8,500 hryvnia.  Gennadiy wants to invest a sum of 20,000 hryvnia into the purchase of additional products, especially, candy, cookies, juice and ice-cream.  Due to the increased variety of product, Gennadiy plans to receive additional profits and buy a refrigerator.  One of Gennadiy's goals is to expand his business and possibly open another retail outlet.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of food products and a refrigerator

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a committed 23-year-old business lady. She is a single mother to a four-year-old child who attends school. To make a living for the last four years, she has been operating a grocery shop. She wants in the next five years, to have expanded her business and employed several people so she can become a manager. Her dream is to be a prosperous business lady.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy kale, tomatoes and onions. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has now become open-minded about business.

loans.use: to buy kale, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна – молодой предприниматель из Запорожья. Она торгует на одном из самых крупных рынков города – Анголенко. Она торгует польскими детскими товарами: верхней одеждой, бельем, шапочками и конвертами. Этот товар Анна считает самым качественным из доступных по цене большинству населения города. Хотя Анна работает в этой сфере торговли всего 3 года, она сумела приобрести хороший опыт и умение торговать.  

Свое дело Анна открыла благодаря помощи мамы, которая отдала ей прилавок и помогла финансово. За 3 года торговли Анна уже вложила 40.000 гривен в это предприятие. Ее ежемесячная чистая прибыль составляет около 6.000 гривен. На данный момент кредит в 20.000 гривен Анне необходим для закупки нового осеннего товара, пока не поднялись оптовые цены. В планах дальнейшего развития своего дела у Анны открытие как минимум еще одной торговой точки в ближайшем будущем. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Anna is a young entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She sells polish-made children's items (outerwear, undergarments, hats and baby carriers) at one of the largest markets in the city - Angolenko. Her goods offer the best quality for a reasonable price, Anna believes. Although she has held this job only for three years, Anna has become very experienced and acquired good salesmanship. 

Anna opened her business with help from her mother, who gave her a market stall and assisted financially. During these three years, Anna has invested 40,000 grivna's into her business and her monthly profit is about 6,000 grivna's. Anna is asking for a loan of 20,000 grivna's to purchase new fall clothing before wholesale prices rise. Anna plans to open a new sales point in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new fall merchandise before wholesale prices rise

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has operated a café business for the past five years. Her customer base is made up of her neighbors and passers-by. She also is engaged in farming and the sales of farm produce, which provides a secondary source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a restaurant in the future.

Beatrice is a married woman with two children: one attends school and one is still too young for school. Beatrice owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she has requested, she wants to purchase tea leaves, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, and farm fertilizers. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, and farm fertilizers

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 49 лет. Она разведена. У нее трое детей. Ее дети находятся на заработках заграницей. Сама Хосият занимается торговлей. Она покупает и продает в оптом прохладительные - безалкогольные напитки. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для покупки оптом минеральной воды и колы.
texts.en: Khosiyat lives in Shahrituz.  She is 49 years old, divorced, and has three children.  Her children are working outside the country.  Khosiyat works in trade.  She buys and sells non-alcoholic soft drinks.  She has been doing this for fifteen years.  She is taking out a loan to buy mineral water and colas wholesale.

loans.use: to buy mineral water and carbonated drinks wholesale.

loans.name: Emmily

texts.en:
Emmily is married and has two children, age 9 and 5 years. 

She has been in farming for 10 years and is also employed as a teacher in Kitale, Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, beans and bananas, which she sells to the local market.

Emmily has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the business will help her educate and feed her children. She hopes to establish a dairy breeding farm.

Emilly says treatment of animals is very costly to farmers. She remains hopeful the loan will be of help.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия замужем и воспитывает двоих сыновей. Она – предприниматель из Орджоникидзе. Наталия торгует разнообразной посудой: стаканами, тарелками, чашками, чайными, столовыми и кофейными сервизами, а также различными сувенирами. У нее 3 торговых точки, одна из них находится в большом торговом центре, куда заходят более состоятельные покупатели и, следовательно, повышается покупательская способность. Наталия занимается этим бизнесом уже 11 лет. Ее доход составляет 14.400 гривен. Чистая прибыль – 4.800 гривен. 

Наталия – молодая и предприимчивая женщина. У нее хорошо поставленный и перспективный бизнес. Наталия хотела бы получить кредит на сумму 15.000 гривен. Она планирует закупить дополнительное количество чайных, кофейных и столовых сервизов. Покупатели Наталии постоянно спрашивают что-то новенькое, поэтому она хотела бы удовлетворить их спрос. Сейчас в торговле Наталии наступило межсезонье. Ее товар пользуется спросом в праздники, поэтому она берет кредит сейчас, чтобы до Нового года было чем торговать. Люди, покупая посуду, получают положительное эстетическое удовольствие, доставляют удовольствие своим близким, преподнося подарки. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Nataliya is married and raising two children.  She is a businesswoman from Ordzhonikidze. Natalia sells various dishes: cups, plates, cups, teaspoons, tablespoons, coffee sets, and various souvenirs. She has three shops: one of them is in a large shopping mall, where more affluent shoppers go and, therefore, customers there have greater purchasing power. Nataliya has been in business for eleven years. Her income is 14,400 hryvnia. Her net profit is 4,800 hryvnia. 

Natalia is a young and enterprising woman. She has a well set-up and promising business. Natalie would like to receive a loan of 15,000 hryvnia. She plans to purchase additional tea, coffee and dinner services. Natalia's buyers are always asking for something new, so she wants to meet their demand. Now is the offseason in Natalia's business. Her products are in demand during the holidays, so she is taking out a loan now, so that before the New Year she will have something to trade. People who buy the dishes, receive pleasure from their beauty and give that pleasure to their loved ones

loans.use: To buy more tea services, coffee services, and dish sets.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a resident of Kitale, where she works as a kindergarten teacher. She also practices farming. 

She has been farming for over 20 years with her produce of milk, maize and beans going to the local market. She is the mother of six children who are all adults, though the last born is still in school.

Florence requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says her focus is to see the last born through his education, and she strongly believes farming will help her achieve this. She hopes to have acquired two more dairy cows in five years.

She says market fluctuations and animal diseases are the greatest challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa has operated a retail shop for the past five years, selling her wares at the market to her neighbors. In addition, she also sells coconuts, which serves as a secondary source of income. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

Mwanahawa and her husband have one child who attends school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the Kshs 80,000 loan she has requested, she wants to purchase a motorcycle to start up a transport business. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to start up a transport business

loans.name: Nouratou  Laï  Lydole

texts.fr: Nouratou Laï Lydole est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un agent commercial du nom de Raoul. Le couple n'a pas d'enfant. Nouratou Laï Lydole a été à l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les charges du ménage, Nouratou Laï Lydole mène comme activité la vente des tissus, des chaussures, des sacs, et des colliers. Nouratou Laï Lydole s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Nouratou Laï Lydole sollicite auprès de ALIDé un cinquième prêt. Les crédits obtenus antérieurement ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Nouratou Laï Lydole, 45, is married to a commercial agent named Raoul. The couple don't have any children. Nouratou Laï Lydole attended school up to the secondary level. In order to support herself and the household, she runs a business selling cloth, shoes, handbags, and necklaces. She buys her supplies in a market in Bénin. 

In order to raise the level of her activity and better address the needs of her clientele, she is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé. Her prior loans have all been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy cloth, shoes, handbags, and necklaces.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 51 and has been in farming for 10 years in her home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. Her farm produces milk, vegetables and eggs. She is married and has four children between 20 and 6 years.

Dinah has made a loan request of 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her purchase and insure a dairy cow  at 31,200 KES and poultry birds at 30,000 KES. She says part of the milk will be consumed within the family, while the rest will be sold to finance the children's education. 

In the future she wants to own six dairy cows and a posho mill for grinding grains within the local market.

Dinah concurs with other farmers on the high cost of animal feed and maintenance.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and poultry birds.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир женат, у него двое взрослых детей. Он живет и работает в Никополе. Владимир торгует мужской спортивной одеждой. Клиент вовремя увидел малую перспективность торговли на рынке и поэтому перенес торговлю в магазин, где товар не затаскивается и не пылится. У Владимира просторный магазин в удобном, проходном месте. В городе мало кто занимается торговлей спортивной одеждой в таком ассортименте и количестве. В магазине есть кондиционер, телевизор, ионизатор воздуха, удобная подсветка. К тому же в магазине есть больше возможности уделить внимание каждому покупателю. 

Владимир занимается торговлей одеждой уже 7 лет. Его доход составляет 27.000 гривен. Владимир регулярно делает закупки нового товара для пополнения ассортимента. Чем больше он закупит товара, тем больше и вероятнее будет его прибыль. Владимир планирует использовать кредит в 17.500 гривен на закупку спортивных костюмов, шортов, футболок, кроссовок и мокасинов. Он знает, что спортивная одежда способствует более здоровому образу жизни молодежи, так как многие покупают одежду для пробежек, занятий в атлетическом зале, катания на лыжах. В планах Владимира – расширять торговую площадь для размещения и продажи большего количества товара.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Vladimir is married and has two adult children. He lives and works in Nikopol. Vladimir trades in man's sportswear. One of his clients suggested that he move his business from the market to a store where his goods do not get worn out and beaten up, and so he did.  Vladimir has a spacious shop in a convenient place on a main thoroughfare. In the city, very few people sell such an assortment and quantity of sportswear. In the shop there is an air conditioner, TV, air ionizer, and good lighting. Additionally, there is a great deal of opportunity to pay attention to every single customer.  

Vladimir has been selling clothes for seven years. He makes 27,000 hryvnias. Vladimir regularly buys new goods to maintain his inventory.  The more variety he has, the more he can profit.  Vladimir plans to use his 17,500 hryvnia loan to buy track suits, shorts, T-shirts, tennis shoes, and deck shoes. He knows that sportswear promotes a more healthy way of life for youth since many buy clothes for jogging, working in gyms, and skiing. Vladimir plans to expand his shop to display and sell more goods.

loans.use: to buy track suits, shorts, T-shirts, tennis shoes, and deck shoes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is engaged in the business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Florence sells her products at the retail level at the market. Florence has requested a loan in the amount of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through offering rental rooms. The main business challenges for Florence include defaulters, transportation costs, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling solely on a wholesale basis, and to start importing clothes herself. 

She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. The family lives in a rented home with access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Scolastick

texts.en:
Scolastick is a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya. She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school.

She has been in farming for 10 straight years, producing milk and vegetables.

She has made a loan request of 31,200 KES, her second with Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will provide milk for the family as well as more money to take children to better schools. 

She aspires to venture into the transport business.

She sees water insecurity as the source of challenges bedeviling the farming industry. She is very happy with Juhudi's services

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is engaged in the business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Jalia sells her products door-to-door on a retail basis. Jalia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. The main business challenges for Jalia include defaulters, transportation costs, and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling solely on a wholesale basis and to provide for the education of her children up to university level.  

Jalia and her husband own a home that has access to electricity but not to piped water. Their major monthly expenses include rent and medication. They have five children, four of whom are in school.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has operated a food stall business for the past six years, selling from her home to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season when business is slow. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Fatuma and her husband own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Their greatest monthly expense is food for the family. They have two children, one of whom has graduated from school and one of whom is still too young for school. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she has requested, Fatuma wants to renovate her food stall and to purchase bales of maize flour and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to renovate her food stall and to purchase bales of maize flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a vendor of coconuts and mangoes, a business in which she has been engaged for the past eight years. She sells her wares at the market to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

Amina and her husband own a house that has access neither to electricity nor to piped water. Their greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. They have seven children, six of whom attend school. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan she has requested, Amina wants to purchase sacks of coconuts and mangoes to offer for sale. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts and mangoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 22 года. Она не замужем. У нее среднее образование. На сегодняшний день она занимается торговлей миндаля. Она собирает миндаль, сушит, а потом выносит на продажу. В основном она ходит по дамам и продает свой товар. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже год. Кредит берет для аренды торговой точки на центральном рынке района.
texts.en: Dilrabo lives in Shahrituz.  She is 22 years old and single.  SHe has a secondary education.  She sells almonds. She gathers almonds, dries them, and then takes them to sell.  Mostly she sells her goods door to door.  She has been doing this work for a year already.  She is taking out a loan to rent a shop in the region's central market.

loans.use: to rent a shop

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy earns a living by selling bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week, selling her products at the retail level at the market. Her main business challenges include defaulters, transportation costs, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and to provide for the education of her children up to university.

Prossy and her husband rent a home without access to electricity or to piped water. Their major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and medication. They have six children, all of whom are in school.  

Prossy has requested a loan in the amount of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and poultry birds

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a mother of 6 children, between 21 and 29 years old, with the last doing his post-secondary education. Esther's farm produces tea, milk, maize, beans, and bananas. She has employed one farmhand.

Esther has requested a loan of 47,100 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income will be used to see her last-born through his education. She is focusing on purchasing a plot of land to increase her farming income.

Esther is grateful to Juhudi for its loan intervention, but says unpredictable weather conditions, like hailstorms, are a constant threat to farmers.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer in Nyamira and is also employed in a local tea factory. He has been practicing mixed farming for 7 years, selling his tea to the Kenya Tea Development Authority, while milk, maize, beans and bananas go to the local market.

David has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to improve his family living standards and the milk to supplement the family meals. David is optimistic he will be able to buy more dairy cows and expand his farm by purchasing more acreage. David says marketing products and animal feeds are the challenges that need to be addressed for future growth of his farming business. He is looking forward to paying the loan to acquire more.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina sells cereals to earn her living. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Madina sells her products at the retail level at the market. Her main business challenges include defaulters, transportation costs, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling solely on a wholesale basis and also to buy a plot of land upon which to build rental rooms. 

Madina and her husband rents a house that has access neither to electricity nor to piped water. Their major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and piped water. They have six children, three of whom are in school. Madina also takes care of her mother.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of ground nuts

loans.use: to buy more bags of ground nuts

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a resident and farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya. She is a widow with 7 adult children. She has been in farming for over 30 years and currently employs one farmhand, permanently, who helps her produce bananas and milk which are sold to the local market.

Agnes has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says it will help her meet basic requirements and general living standards. She plans to buy an additional dairy cow in 2 years. Her biggest challenges are animal diseases and scarcity of water.

This is Agnes' third loan with Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has operated a tailoring business for the past eight years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Fatuma and her husband own a house that has no access to electricity or piped water. Their greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. They have two children, both of whom attend school. 

With the Kshs 15,000 loan she has requested, she wants to purchase cloth materials for tailoring, as well as to buy khangas to offer for sale. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for tailoring, as well as to buy khangas to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mwandiki

texts.en:
Mwandiki is aged 43 and has been in farming for the last 20 years producing and selling bananas, milk and coffee on the local market. He is married with two children aged 12 and 9 years. He has one farmhand.

Mwandiki has made a loan request amounting to 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says he will use the income generated to educate his children and repay the loan. He is also focusing on buying three more dairy cows in order to run a farm of five.

Mwandika laments poor weather conditions and animal diseases as the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase horticultural seeds to grow fodder.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista lives in Uganda. She is widowed and has eight children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).  Teopista has a business selling charcoal and bananas. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days out of every week.  Teopista sells her products from home, by means of wholesale and retail. Teopista has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas.  Teopista earns additional income by selling mats and baskets.    The main business challenges for Teopista include defaulters, thieves, transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and to buy a plot of land. Teopista lives in a home that she rents. She doesn't have access to electricity but does have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. Immaculate is a fruit vendor. She has been in this business for sevens, and she works seven days out of every week. Immaculate sells her products at the market by means of retail. Immaculate has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bundles of sugar cane and jackfruit. She also generates additional income through a motorcycle (chauffeur) business. The main business challenges for Immaculate include defaulters, transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and to buy a plot of land. Immaculate lives in a home that she rents. She doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of sugarcane and jackfruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry and rabbits.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man with two children; one child attends school and one is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Nicholas' greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six months, Nicholas has operated a business selling vegetables from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in his business. His major dream is to become a leading vegetable seller in the market. 

Nicholas plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of vegetables for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase horticultural seeds.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a single man who lives in a rented house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are house rent and school fees for his younger brother.

Geofrey is requesting 20,000 KES to start a retail business. He wants to purchase household consumables of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, detergents, and salts.

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to start his business and change his living standards. He dreams of expanding his business and having a better future.

loans.use: To purchase household consumables for his retail business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 36 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 9 and 16. She runs a small restaurant, in which she sells food to the local people. Her business is located near Wilson airport, and she is served by the Kitengela branch. She has been running this business for six years now and employs five people. She plans to use her loan to purchase meat, rice, cooking flour, and other ingredients to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. 

Nancy plans to use the profit from her business to buy a car and a plot of land on which she will build rental houses. She describes herself as honest, reliable and visionary.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, and other ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling shoes at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of competition from other shoe sellers in the market. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of shoes to resell. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of shoes to resell

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is paraffin. 

For the past year, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition from other tailors in the area. She dreams of establishing a dressing school in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth material for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.fr: Alphonse est salarie, il  est marie, il a  de 57 ans, il a 11 enfants de son charge entre 9 ans et 30 ans et il est né au Rwanda. Son niveau d’éducation est la licence en Théologie. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB.  Il va acheter des ciments, peintures pour  renouveler  sa maison, et payer la main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est  la construction d’une belle maison remplit des conditions exige par le plan directeur de sa  ville. Dans l’avenir il voudrait construire d’autre maison destine à louer et payer le frais de scolarité pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Alphonse is salaried, married, and 57 years old. He has eleven children to support, ranging in age from 9 to 30. He was born in Rwanda and has a degree in theology. This loan cycle is his third one with ACB. He is going to buy cement and some paint to renovate his house and to pay for labor. His strategy for growth is to build a nice house outfitted to the demands of the planning official in his city. For the future, Alphonse would like to build another house for renting out and to cover the cost of education for his children.

loans.use: to buy cement and paint for renovating his house and paying for labor

loans.name: Mchekondo

texts.en:
Mchekondo is a widow with three children. All her children graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mchekondo has operated a vegetable stall for four years, selling at the market to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of vegetables in the future.

With the KSHS 60,000, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki comes from the village of Ksovrisi in Mtskheta District. He is 39 years old and married. Akaki lives with his wife Mariam, 17-year-old son and 14-year-old daughter. His children go to school.

Akaki owns a small mixed store in the village. Village people can buy grocery products as well as a variety of household goods in Akaki’s store. The family owns one milk cow. Mariam makes yogurt and cheese from the milk. These dairy products are also sold in the store. 

Akaki requested a loan to equip the store with additional refrigerators. In the summer period, the demand for dairy products (cheese, milk, yogurt, ice cream etc) as well as cold soft drinks increases. The existing refrigerators aren’t enough to store all the products. 

When Akaki has additional refrigerators, he will be able to increase his inventories as well as the turnover in the store. This will raise the income of the family, which will be used to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase refrigerators for his store

loans.name: Dzendere

texts.en:
Dzendere is a married woman with ten children, five of whom attend school while five already graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are fuel and food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a palm wine selling business, selling to her neighbors. In addition she also sells fresh water to her neighbours which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to establish a club in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to start a clothes selling business, and will purchase bundles of secondhand clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 3 dozen plain dishes and 6 dozen ‘super’ dishes

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Armen lives in Yerevan with his mother, who is jobless. 
After serving in the Armenian Army, he worked in the trading sector for several years. For about 3.5 years, he has been making rolls of tin foil and plastic wrap, which are used to preserve food and for baking. Armen constructed his rolling device by himself and he set up his business with a relative of his. But six months ago, his relative left Armenia, and now Armen carries on his business alone. 
Armen buys tin foil from an Armenian factory and Chinese-produced plastic wrap from a wholesale fair. Recently, Armen received an offer for Chinese tin foil purchasing, but he rejected that proposal as he prefers to work with domestic manufacturers. 
Armen sells his tin foil and plastic wrap to supermarkets and corner stores. He uses the profit from the business for his family. 
Armen is seeking a loan of 700,000 AMD to buy raw materials for his business. The supermarkets pay Armen 90 days after shipment, so this loan will help him cover the cost of raw materials.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his business

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold is a single man with three children, all of whom attend school. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past eight years, he has operated a posho mill machine. His potential customers are neighbors grinding maize (into flour). He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of purchasing another posho mill machine in the future. 

With the 60,000 KES he wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Kweyamba Women's Namawojolo Group

texts.en:
39-year-old Zam has been operating her soft drinks business for the past 20 years in Lugazi. The happily married mother of 1 says she began this business with savings from her farm sales business. 20 years have been years of nothing but hard work, sacrifice, determination and perseverance. Without that perseverance she says she would not have achieved that longevity. She says the huge market for soft drinks in her area of operation keeps her business going. Most of her drinks sell highly during the dry seasons, and demand normally subsides during the rainy seasons.

Travelers along the route that leads one from Kampala, Uganda's capital city, to the east side of the country are normally the ones who buy a treat of her drinks. This route has many traveler refreshment stopovers, notably in the area where Zam operates.  On the side, Zam also does farming and cattle raising.

She says her gross monthly sales profit totals up to 250,000 Ugandan shillings (~$97), and she says with this Kiva loan she intends to purchase more soft drinks, like sodas and passion fruit juice, to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, like sodas and passion fruit juice, to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, wheat flour, maize and cooking oil.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Compone, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco El socio pertenece al banco Mujeres en Accion, porque inicialmente eran solo mujeres y luego invitaron a sus parejas, hijos y familias tanto varones como mujeres, entonces el banco no puede cambiar de nombre, por estar ya registrado y bien constituido.

El socio es el Sr. Cirilo; el socio tiene 55 años; el socio es casado y tiene 5 hijos, los cuales son ya todos independientes, el socio se dedica al comercio minorista, el socio compra y vende cerdos, el está en el negocio de cerdos y nos comenta que compra cerdos tiernos y los cría, alimenta y engorda para luego venderlo en las diferentes ferias o mercados regionales, Aunque en esta ocasión el socio invertira su credito en el arreglo de su casa, el socio requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en el revestimiento de su vivienda, el socio en esta ocasión desea el crédito para los materiales de construcción de su casa propia, el socio ira pagando sus cuotas con lo que le genera la venta de sus animales, entre otros que cría están las aves de corral y cuyes también. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la construcción y revestimiento de su vivienda.

El socio se muestra muy satisfecho y agradecido por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank, " Mujeres en Accion" (Women in Action), and the bank is part of the Compone district, a province in Anta and department of Cusco. The member is part of this bank, because initially it started with just women and then they invited their partners, children, and family members to join - men as well as women - and at that point the bank could not change its name because it was already registered and populated. 

Cirilo is 55 years old, married, and has 5 children whom are all independent.  Cirilo is a merchant who buys and sells pigs; he is in the pig business. He tells us he purchases young pigs and raises them, feeds them, and fattens them up to later sell at various fairs or regional markets.  He seeks this loan to be able to invest in the remodeling of his home.  In this occasion he would like the loan for the constuction materials for his home.  This member would pay his installments from what he earns selling his animals;  poultry and guinea pigs are amongst some of the other animals Cirilo raises.  This member is soliciting this loan to invest in construction materials to remodel his home.

As a member he finds himself very thankful for the support offered via these means and he comitts himself to fulfill his payments in the time allotted.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of construction materials and remodeling his home.

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo is from the village of Apnia, Akhalkalaki District, South Georgia. He is 50 years old and lives with his wife, Natela, and their 20-year-old daughter. 

Rezo is a farmer. He has 2 milk cows, from which Natela produces 40 kg of cheese per month, which she sells locally. The family also owns 6 hectares of agricultural land, of which 3 hectares is used to grow potatoes, 2 hectares to grow barley and 1 hectare to grow wheat. The family works hard in the spring and summer months to get a good harvest. Rezo takes all of the harvested products to the capital city and sells them on the open market. 

Rezo plans to use the requested credit to purchase a large sized metal rake to be used for raking the grass in August. Rezo rakes his fields for hours. He will store the collected grass and use it in the winter for feeding the cows. Once he has his own raking equipment, he won’t have to rent it from neighboring farmers. His costs will diminish and, accordingly, the family's profit will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a metal rake to make hay

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Compone, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila; la socia tiene 38 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, de 10, 8 y 2 años de edad;  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista de compra y venta de verduras, la socia vende zanahorias, cebollas y pasto para cuyes; la socia vende en un stand en el mercado, la socia también desea invertir el crédito en la compra de verduras y paga a su proveedor de poco a poco mientras le dan las verduras según ella va vendiendo, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de verduras para la venta.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “MUJERES EN ACCION” ["Women in Action"] communal bank. The bank is in the Compone district of Anta province, in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Lucila, and she is 38 years old. She has a live-in partner and 3 children, aged 10, 8 and 2. Her work is a retail business, buying and selling vegetables. She sells carrots and onions as well as grass to feed guinea pigs. She sells her products at a stand in the market. She would like to invest the loan in buying vegetables and also paying her provider little by little to continue supplying her with vegetables while she sells them. The borrower is requesting the loan to invest in buying vegetables to sell. 

Lucila is very satisfied and grateful for the support which is being provided to her in this way, and she is committed to paying off her debt on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Compone, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonia; la socia tiene 39 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, el menor tiene 14 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la atención y cuidado de sus terreno de cultivo, la socia desea sembrar esta época maíz y papa, la socia comenta que como ya es tiempo de sembrío de maíz y de papa, ella desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de semillas de maíz y semilla de papa para sembrar en sus terrenos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para la nueva siembra.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the “MUJERES EN ACCION” communal bank in the Compone district of the Cusco province.

She’s 39 years old, is in a live-in relationship, and has four children, with the youngest being 14 years old.  Antonia has and cares for her farmland wants to raise corn and potatoes, especially now that it’s corn and potato planting season.  She is asking for this loan to buy corn and potato seed for the new crop.

Antonia is very satisfies and grateful for the support she’s gotten through this means and she is committed to making her payments in accordance with the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy potato and corn seed.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Compone, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carlota; la socia tiene 31 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, de 3, 2 años de edad;  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista la socia tiene su negocio de venta de lácteos, la socia elabora quesos, leche, yogurt natural, La socia tiene vacas lecheras y terrenos de cultivo, sin embargo lo que producen en esta zona no es suficiente para generar empresas mayoristas y ellos son minoristas, ala socia elabora sus diferentes productos y ella los lleva a vender a todos sus clientes, La socia desea invertir el crédito por el momento en la compra de ingredientes para completar con el negocio de hacer yogurt, quesos y también vender leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes e insumos para la elaboración de quesos y yogurt.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carlota is a member of the “Mujeres en Accion” communal bank, located in the Campone district, Anta province, Cusco department.

She’s 31 years old, is in a live-in relationship, and has two children, ages three and two.  She has a small business where she sells milk products, cheeses, and natural milk yogurt.  She has dairy cows and farmland; however items in this zone are not produced in sufficient quantities to form large companies, so they are all small businesses.  Carlota makes her various products and takes them to her customers to sell.  She would like to invest the money from this loan to complement her dairy business, and buy ingredients for making cheese and yogurt.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support she gets through this media and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dairy business.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Compone, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benedicta; la socia tiene 36 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, de 5, 4 y 7 meses de edad;  La socia se dedica a la crianza de cuyes al por mayor para la venta en las diferentes ferias, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de 50 cuyes ya que ella tiene ahora un total de 60 ella desea incrementar esta cantidad con otra parte del préstamo ella comprara mas corrales y el alimento para los cuyes, La socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de 50 cuyes para la crianza y reproducción de los mismos los cuales serán vendidos una vez que estos alcancen la madures. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar 50 cuyes.

 La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Benedicta is a member of the MUJERES EN ACCION community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Benedicta is partnered and has 3 children: 5-years, 4-years and 7-months old, respectively.  She operates a business raising guinea pigs that she then sells at local markets.  She is applying for a loan so that she can buy 50 guinea pigs--to add to the 60 that she has no-- and the supplies she needs to care for them.  She will raise and breed the animals so that she can sell them when they're ready for market.

Sra. Benedicta is very thankful for the support that this kind of lending provides and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy 50 guinea pigs for animal-sales business.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a married man with one child who attends school. He owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Amos has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business; his potential customers are town dwellers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

Amos plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to start a retail shop and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To start a retail shop and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima‘s group is comprised of eight hardworking women. Halima is 20 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Halima has operated a business selling vegetables and fruits for 8 years.         

To help expand her business, Halima has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase vegetables and fruits for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Halima hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Halima hopes to own a plot of land. Halima is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her about HIV/AIDS.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr:
Cliente de Hope Congo âgée de 47 ans; célibataire avec deux (2) enfants  a  sa charge. Il y a bientôt 9 ans qu'elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de poisson sale a l'arrêt de ses études. Ses ventes journalières varient de 20.000f à 30.000frs. 

Avec le prêt elle veut élargir son activité en achetant des cartons de poissons sales comme la morue, le thon, la sole, capitaine, et ses intentions c'est commencer déjà à faire la vente en demi gros et détails. 


A la longue, elle veut ouvrir un dépôt de poisson sale pour être grossiste et avec ses bénéfices elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et aussi amener ses enfants à faire des études universitaires.
texts.en:
This borrower is a client of Hope Congo, 47 years old and single, raising two children. She has been selling salted fish for almost nine years, ever since she left school. Her daily sales total between 20,000 and 20,000 frs. 

With the loan she wants to expand her business by buying cartons of salted fish such as cod, tuna, flounder and sword fish and her intention is to begin already to do intermediate trade as well as retail. 

In the long run, she wants to open a warehouse for salted fish in order to be a wholesaler and with her profit she intends to improve living conditions for her family and also send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy salted fish, tuna, flounder, and sword fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil and plantains

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past twelve years, she has operated a business selling fish at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to expand her business in the future. 

With the 60,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil and plantains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase coal and oil

loans.name: Áreas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Áreas está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras los cuales se dedican a comercializar perecederos. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Raquel quien vende frutas desde hace 2 años en el mercado de Masaya. Ella semanalmente vende aproximadamente 12,800. 
Raquel con el crédito comprara cosechas de perecederos de temporada.
Los otros integrantes son  Sebastiana de los Ángeles quien comercializa frutas y verduras desde hace cinco años y  José Alberto quien desde 1992 se dedica a la compra y venta de piña.
texts.en:
The A. group has three members, all enterprising and hard-working, who operate businesses selling perishables.  The group coordinator is Sra. Raquel who has sold fruit in the market at Masaya for 2 years.  She sells approximately 12,800 cordobas per week.  
Raquel will use this loan to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables.  
The other members of the group are Sebastiana de los Angeles who has operated a business selling fruit and vegetables for five years and Jose Alberto who, since 1992, has operated a business selling pineapples.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for food-sales business.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is a single man who owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Tsuma has operated a business buying and selling maize and charcoal. He sells from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of scarcity of maize products for sale. Tsuma dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

Tsuma plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of maize for sale. He decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fifty bags of coal

loans.name: Doreen's Group

texts.en:
Doreen's group is comprised of six hardworking women. Doreen is 19 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Doreen has operated a business selling clothes for 3 years. She sells shoes as her secondary business.  

To help expand her business, Doreen has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Doreen hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Doreen hopes to expand her clothing business. Doreen is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is 41 years old and lives on the outskirts of the city of Ibarra in northern Ecuador. He is married and lives with his wife and his children. Luis is a father of four children aged 16, 15, 10, and 8 years old, respectively. Luis is a hardworking man who takes responsibility for his family. He is a man of good character. Luis' business is selling animals, especially pigs, guinea pigs, and cattle at the market. He began this business when he married over 20 years ago. Luis began by selling animals to his neighbors. Now, 20 years later, he uses micro loans to more easily obtain the capital necessary to purchase animals to sell at a profit. Earlier in the history of his business, he used to obtain his capital from loan sharks who charged him daily for their money-lending services. Luis works with his wife, who is pictured beside him in the photo. Luis reports that his business is going well and with the earnings he sees, he invests in the education of his children. His loan will be used to purchase more pigs. His past loans have given him the opportunity to buy his animals, pay a low interest rate, and get his loan quickly so he could get to work. Luis’ dream is to build a new house on new land in the next year. He wants to continue his work with his business and support his family.

In the photo, Luis and his wife are pictured with their guinea pigs, as Luis had not yet had the opportunity to purchase the pigs that this loan will finance.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with eight children. Five of her children attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumptions like maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join to because of favorable loan procedures.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and charcoal

loans.name: Pedro Ruperto

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Ruperto es un hombre trabajador quien es agente de seguridad de ENACAL desde hace 2 años. Él antes de empezar a trabajar tenía un negocio de repuestos de bicicletas pero por la situación económica no continuó con él.
Actualmente el necesita el crédito para volver a iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Ruperto is a hard-working man.  He's been a security guard at ENACAL for 2 years.  Before that, he owned a business selling bicycle parts, a business he wasn't able to continue because of the poor economic situation.  
He needs a loan now to restart the business.

loans.use: to restart his bicycle parts business.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.fr: Evariste est né  au Rwanda. Il est marié, il  a 30 ans, il a 1 enfant de 6 mois. Il  a 2 ans des études secondaires. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour entretien de son taxi minibus. Il  n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est posséder plus d’un minibus pour le taxi. Pour ses ambitions il voudrait fonder l’agence de voyage internationale en utilisant des grands bus, et payer les frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Evariste was born in Rwanda. He is married, is 30 years old, and has a 6-month-old baby. He has had two years of high school education. This is his second loan with ACB. He is going to use his loan to maintain his minibus taxi. He has no foreseeable reason not to repay his loan. His strategy to expand his business is to have more than one minibus for his taxi business. Regarding his ambitions, he would like to open an international travel agency using big buses and pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: to maintain his minibus taxi

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en: Everlyn is 29 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has five children between the ages of 3 and 12, all of whom attend school. For the past four years, Everlyn has been selling dried goods (rice, oil, soap, etc.) in her community where she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. Everlyn plans to send her children to a quality school in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 44 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. For the past three years, Janet has been selling vegetables, oil, salt and other items on a little table in front of her house. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. Janet plans to send her children to quality schools in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business

loans.name: Julo

texts.en:
Julo is a married man with four children; two attend school while two are adults. He owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Julo has operated a business buying and selling livestock at the market to butcher operators. He faces the challenge of rising livestock prices at the market. His dream is to establish a retail shop in the future.

Julo plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase a cow and a goat for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and a goat for resale.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en: Lorpu is 32 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 14, all of whom attend school. For the past six years, Lorpu has been selling many items such as rice, oil, soap, milk, etc. in a little shop in her community. Sometime there are fewer customers and it makes her feel very bad. Lorpu is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business

loans.name: Mola

texts.en:
Mola is a divorced man with two school-going children. They live in a house that they own; it has no electricity nor piped water. Mola's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, Mola has operated a business selling maize from home to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is competition from other maize sellers in his area of operation. Mola's major dream is to establish a maize selling stall in the future.

Mola plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of maize for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Amalia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Amalia Del Socorro, tiene 48 años es soltera y tiene 3 hijos ya mayores de edad. Amalia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como ropa, cosméticos, juguetes usados y productos escolares, esto como consecuencia de que la escuela en donde trabaja de maestra generalmente hacen pedidos y ella aprovecho esta oportunidad como un medio para incrementar sus ingresos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de más mercaderías principalmente ropa y cosméticos ya que actualmente posee bastantes pedidos y desea aprovechar. Ella realiza sus compras en el mercado de Managua. Ella posee el sueño de seguir creciendo en su negocio de tal forma que algún día realice mejoras a su casa que le permitan vivir de una forma más cómoda.
texts.en: Amalia Del Socorro is 48 years old, single, and has three adult children.  She sells general merchandise, such as clothing, cosmetics, second hand toys, and school supplies.  The school where she works as a teacher generally makes requests and she took advantage of this opportunity as a way to increase her income.  She will invest the money from this loan to buy more merchandise, primarily clothing and cosmetics, now that she has plenty of requests and she wants to take advantage of that.  She buys her supplies in the Managua market.  Her dream is to continue growing her business and one day be able to make improvements to her home and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her business.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro, vive solamente con su hija, tiene casa propia, el negocio de Ramiro inicio hace 10 años, trabaja de lunes a sábado y trata en la venta de ropa de forma ambulante, recorriendo varias calles del mercado y zona céntrica de la ciudad.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa para surtir el negocio, camisas, ropa interior, short, en variados estilos y colores, este préstamo le ayudara para que su negocio no disminuya, sino que se mantenga, pues debe generar ingresos para su hija y para su propia alimentación.
 Su objetivo es generar mayores ventas, contar con voluntad para vender ambulante, apoyar a su hija en sus estudios para que pueda superarse.
texts.en:
Ramiro lives with his daughter in his own home.  He started his own business 10 years ago and works Monday to Saturday selling clothing on foot, through the streets of the city’s marketplace and central zones.

He is asking for this loan to buy clothing to supply his business with a greater variety of shirts, undergarments, and shorts in various styles and colors.  This loan will help him so that his business will not diminish.  He needs to generate income in order to feed himself and his daughter.

His objective is to generate greater sales, maintain his motivation to continue selling on foot, and support his daughter in her studies so that she can succeed.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Lourdes Isabel

texts.en:
Lourdes is 54 years old and lives in Ibarra, Ecuador. She is divorced and lives with her three children. Her oldest daughter is 13 years old, her son is three years old, and her youngest daughter is two months old. Lourdes is a humble person. To support her family, she runs a store and paints ceramics to sell in the market. Lourdes began her business bit by bit. First, she sold toilet paper and sanitary napkins door-to-door. Later, she started selling eggs. Eventually, she opened a storefront and has been continuing to slowly expand her business. Lourdes reports that her sales are currently down due to school vacations but she has a good business because she has the only store on the block.

Lourdes is requesting a loan to stock her store with rice, sugar, noodles, lentils, toilet paper, and soft drinks and to purchase ceramics to paint. This will be her first loan. In the past, she was afraid to put herself in debt. Now, as her businesses have grown, she is confident she can repay her loan. Lourdes believes this loan will help her move forward with her children. Her dreams are to have her own land to build a house and live with her children and to have a larger store with a freezer and more windows.

loans.use: to stock her general store and buy ceramics

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy a 48-year-old woman who lives in West Point. She stopped her education at only grade seven. She is married with seven children ages 12 to 31. All of her children live at home with her. Nancy, whose husband is out of a job, has to sell charcoal for the survival of her family. Sometimes it is difficult, but most of the times she realizes a profit and she uses it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase 50 bags of charcoal for her business. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase 50 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry business selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of disease outbreak in her poultry business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with nine children. Seven of her children attend school and one has graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Fatuma owns a posho mill machine to grind maize, which has been in operation for the past four years. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She also sells vegetables, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces the major challenge of seasonality, especially during the dry hot season when there is no maize for grinding, hence a low income is generated. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 80,000, she wants to repair her posho mills and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice to establish a retail shop,. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To repair her posho mills and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice to establish a retail shop,.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 36 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and stopped her education at only sixth grade. She has three children aged 2 to 14, all of whom are currently in school. For some years, Sarah has been selling dried goods in the local market. Sometimes business is very slow. Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She plans to build her own house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business

loans.name: Kichangani Group

texts.en:
Fransis, who is in his mid-40s, is married and has four children who are still at school. He has been running two businesses, a hardware shop and a a general store. He works from 6 a.m to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Fransis' 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to expand the hardware shop and to pay school fees and household expenses. He has repaid all his loans successfully. Fransis hopes for a loan to increase his general store inventory. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Fransis will share this loan with his group "Kichangani" which consists of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To increase his store's inventory.

loans.name: Maria Florencia

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria es casada, tiene varios hijos, todos ya mayores D. edad, con ocupaciones laborales, su marido es técnico en refrigeración,  realiza trabajos a domicilio y en su casa, son una familia trabajadora.
Ella tiene una despensa, la que explota hace ya 10 años, por medio D. este negocio ella logra generar un poco D. ingresos con lo cual logra ayudar a su marido con los gastos D. la casa. La Sra Maria es muy conocida en el barrio asi que por eso tiene mucha clientela. 
Ella comenta que uno D. sus sueños es poder ampliar su pequeña despensa, pues D. esa forma podrá ofrecer más comodidades a sus clientes.
