Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has several adult children who work.  Her husband is a refrigeration technician and makes house calls and also works out of his home.  They are a hard working family.

She’s had a grocery store for ten years and generates an income which allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.  Maria is very well known in the neighborhood and has many customers.  She says that her dreams are to be able to expand her small store and be able to offer more items to her customers.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy food, drinks, and vegetables to stock her store.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that it gives her.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Sherrie

texts.en: Sherrie is 44 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has four children, who are currently in school. Sherrie stopped her education at only 7th grade. For the past few years, Sherrie has been selling charcoal; however, she normally doesn’t make a lot of money during the rainy season. Sherrie is requesting a loan to purchase 30 bags of charcoal. She plans to build her own house in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase 30 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Katungulu Development Group

texts.en: Rose, 38 years old, has operated a grocery store in Lugazi for the past 5 years. The happily married mother of 5 says she began this business with the inspiration of her husband. Before that, she farmed. She still engages in farming but it is now subsidiary to her grocery store. Rose says she is able to sell some of the crops she grows on her farm, such as groundnuts and pineapples. She also sells all sorts of snacks, jackfruit, soft drinks, apples, etc. Rose earns weekly sales profits of UGX 150,000. She intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more jackfruit, apples, soft drinks and other green fruits to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more jackfruit, apples, soft drinks and other green fruits to resell.

loans.name: Anastasie Berthe

texts.fr: Mariée, Anastasie est mère de 4 enfants, tous scolarisés. Ils vivent dans leur propre maison. Son époux, électricien bâtiment exerçant à son propre compte, prend en charge les dépenses du foyer mais Anastasie y participe aussi de façon non négligeable. La relation commercialise de la farine de blé (en sacs), du sucre en poudre et de l'huile alimentaire en bidons et ce; depuis 11 ans à son domicile sis à Calavi-Djadjo. Elle a associé à son activité principale la distribution des tissus de marques HITAGET, PHOENIX, BINTA et autres. Sa clientèle est constituée de la population de sa zone et de ses environs. Anastasie s'approvisionne à Tokpa, le marché international du Bénin et à Missèbo, un marché de la capitale économique du Bénin. Après quelques ventes, Anastasie constate qu'elle n'est plus en mesure de satisfaire d'autres clients, raison pour laquelle elle s'est rapprochée de FINADEV pour le renouvellement afin d'augmenter sa capacité d'approvisionnement. Les bénéfices qu’engendrera le présent micro crédit lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et familiaux. Elle est à son 1er crédit à FINADEV.
texts.en:
A married woman, Anastasie is the mother of four children who are all in school. They live in their own house. Her husband is a freelance building electrician and is responsible for household expenses, but Anastasie also helps out to a significant degree. 

Our client sells wheat flour (in sacks), powdered sugar, and vegetable oil in containers. She has been doing so for eleven years out of her home located in Calavi-Djadjo. Along with her main business, she has included the distribution of cloth having the brand names of HITAGET, PHOENIX, BINTA, and other. Her customer base is composed of the people in her district and nearby. She gets her supplies from Tokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Missèbo, a market in the economic capital of Benin. 

After a few sales, Anastasie noticed she is no longer satisfying other customers. This is why she inquired with FINADEV to reinvigorate her business in order to increase her ability to resupply her inventory. 

The profits that this micro-loan will produce will enable her to support herself and her family. She is on her first FINADEV loan.

loans.use: to buy five 25-liter containers of oil, five sacks of wheat flour, and two sacks of sugar

loans.name: Mariga

texts.en:
Mariga is a widowed woman with eight children. Two of her children attend school and six are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a restaurant business, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators in the area. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans.

loans.name: El Rayito De Luz Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “EL RAYITO DE LUZ” y se ubica en el Estado de México. Esta comunidad se distingue por su gente trabajadora, por la ganadería y además por sus lindos paisajes. El grupo esta conformado por 8 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo. La señora María es la presidenta del grupo. Inició su negocio desde hace diez años, en un pequeño local donde vende nieve de distintos sabores que ella misma elabora, pide el prestamo para comprar materia prima como fruta, garrafas, hielo para seguir produciendo y asi tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella tiene 33 años, estudió la secundaria, siempre se ha distinguido por ser una persona con muchas ganas de superarse con el deseo de brindarle dia a dia lo mejor a su familia y vive felizmente casada con tres hijos de 14, 9 y 8 años de edad.
texts.en:
This group is called “EL RAYITO DE LUZ” and is located in the State of Mexico.  This community is known for its hard working people, its livestock, and its beautiful landscapes.  The group is made up of eight members and this is their first loan request.

María is the group’s president and she started her business in a small location ten years ago.  She sells different kinds of ice cream, of different flavors, that she makes herself.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy ingredients such as fruit, pitchers, and ice in order to continue her production and be able to offer a greater variety to her customers.  She is 33 years old, has a junior high school education, and has always distinguished herself as a person with a great desire to get ahead and provide the best for her family every day.  She is happily married and has three children, ages 14, 9, and 8.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients for her ice cream sales business.

loans.name: Alberta Georgina

texts.en:
Alberta Georgina, who prefers her middle name, is 54 years old and lives in Ibarra, Ecuador. She is single and lives alone although she has six adult children. Her oldest son is Juan Luis, 39, followed by daughter Geoconda, 37, son Jeferson, 35, son Walter, 31, son Javier, 30, and daughter Belgica, 27. Georgina has nearly twenty grandchildren. Georgina is calm and does not have a problem with anyone and she likes to support and help others when she can. 

Georgina is requesting a loan to support her two small businesses: painting ceramics, and selling women’s underwear. She began as a businesswoman by selling CDs and movies in Guayaquil, Ecuador, but quit that business because it was dangerous to sell in the streets of Guayaquil and she lost money to robberies and assaults. A few years ago, she moved to Ibarra and two years ago took a class in painting ceramics. Georgina enjoys this new work and says that it is a lot less stressful. This will be her first loan and she will use it to buy ceramics, paint, and underwear to sell. She believes the loan will help her cover her costs. Georgina’s dream is to continue prospering so that she can have a pleasant old age. She also would like to have her own storefront where she can exhibit her works.

loans.use: to buy paint and ceramics for her craft as well as women's underwear to sell

loans.name: Arciliano

texts.es:
El Sr. Arciliano está casado con la Sra. Acelina hace varios años tienen 4 hijos menores que aún están cursando la escuela primaria. 
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que está ubicada en ciudad del Este, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como asalariados.
El comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio,  puesto que ya llevan un buen tiempo en este trabajo. El se define como un hombre muy trabajador y luchador, dice que todo lo que hace es por el bien de sus hijos,  para darles un mejor futuro y una buena educación.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, arroz, jabones, y otros, con lo cual desea abastecer su negocio. El ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones
texts.en:
Arciliano has been married to Acelina for several years; they have four minor children that are still in elementary school.

Together they set up a store in their home located in Ciudad Del Este.  They started out with a small amount of capital that they had saved up from previous salaried employment they’d had.

He comments that he does well with the business because they’ve been in it for some time now.  He defines himself as a very hardworking, tenacious man.  He says that everything is for his children’s wellbeing, to give them a better future and a good education.

He is asking for the loan to buy sugar, rice, soap and others to stock the store.  He has had previous loans with us and he repaid in an excellent way.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap and others.

loans.name: Yama

texts.en:
Yama is a married man with three children. One of his children attends school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business selling to his neighbors and passersby. He also grows maize to sell, which contributes to his other source of income. He faces the major challenge of the high cost of transporting goods from town to his place of sale. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and cooking fat oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pans, shirts, perfume, creams, treatments, lipstick, powder, towels and sheets.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
La Sra. Ceferina es viuda tiene un hijo ya mayor de edad que trabaja como mecánico, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas en forma ambulante. 
Ella comenta que por medio de sus ventas puede generar los ingresos que necesita para la manutención de la casa. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que por medio de su sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante, uno de sus máximos sueños es poder tener un local donde poder exponer o exhibir las ropas que vende.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de invierno, pues está recibiendo mucha demanda de ese tipo de ropas. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito, ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Ceferina is a widow.  She has an adult son who works as a mechanic.  She is a clothing vendor.

She comments that her sales make it possible for her to generate income that she needs to support her household.  She defines herself as a very hard working, tenacious woman who through her sacrifice has managed to get ahead.  One of her greatest dreams is to be able to have a locale where she can display the clothes she sells.

She is asking for the loan to buy winter clothes because she’s getting a lot of demand for this type of clothes.  She is very hopeful about the loan because it will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with seven children. Five of her children attend school and two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Dzame has been operating a retail shop business selling to her neighbors and passersby. She sells household consumptions like sugar, maize flour and wheat flour. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transporting goods to her place of operation because of poor roads. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien desde 1986  es docente de una escuela rural. Ella ha tenido con Adim seis créditos con los cuales ha ido mejorando su vivienda poco a poco.
Con este crédito ella cambiara el techo ya que está muy deteriorado y su sueño es poder tener su casa cada día mejor.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is a hard working, enterprising woman who has been a Teacher in a rural school since 1986.  She has had six Adim loans that she’s used to gradually improve her home.

She will use this loan to replace the roof which is very deteriorated.  Her dream is to improve her house more each day.

loans.use: to replace the roof.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Virgilio; el tiene 38 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi en la ruta de Izcuchaca-Cusco, el socio también se dedica a la agricultura, el socio cultiva maíz y trigo y los productos agrícolas lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en la provincia de Anta, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de transporte y también mejorar las tierras de. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su carro y mantenimiento de su carro y también para comprar semillas para las tierras de cultivo.
                                              
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Virgilio, 38, belongs to the “Mujeres en Accion” (Women in Action) communal bank located in Anta District that belongs to Anta Province and Cusco Department.

He is married and has five children.  He alternates his daily chores with providing public transportation services.  He has a car that provided taxi services along the Izcuchaca-Cusco route.  He’s also a farmer.  He grows corn and wheat and sells his crops in the various markets taking place in Anta province.  He wants to expand the transportation business and improve his lands and is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for his car, to service his car and also to buy seeds for his crops.

He is happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy auto parts, to repair his car and also to buy seeds for his crops.

loans.name: Ramona Ignacia

texts.es:
La  Sra. Ramona es separada, tiene un hijo en edad escolar, vive en Ciudad del Este.
Ella se dedica al alquiler de casas y piezas en la zona de Ciudad del Este, siendo este un negocio de acceso a una clientela constante, colabora con que sea rentable, por lo cual tiene un poco más de ingresos. Es una persona destacada por su responsable conducta en cuanto al cumplimiento de sus obligaciones, tanto en el ámbito familiar como laboral.
Cuenta que su sueño es poder seguir ampliando sus piezas, para que de esa forma pueda ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus inquilinos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la refacción de las piezas que ella alquila, sabe que el crédito le será de gran ayuda, desde ya, agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
Ramona is separated. She has a school-aged son. She lives in Ciudad del Este.

She rents houses and rooms in Ciudad del Este. This is a business with constant access to clients, which makes it profitable, so she has a little more income. She is a person who stands out for her responsible conduct in following through with her obligations, both at home and at work.

She tells us that her dream is to continue expanding her rooms so that she can offer greater comfort to her renters.

She is requesting the loan to make repairs to the rooms that she rents out. She knows the loan will be a great help right now. She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity given her.

loans.use: to repair rental houses.

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 20 years she has operated a business selling vegetables to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her dream is to expand her business in the future.

With the 15,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a married woman with three children. Two children attend school while one is still too young for school. Nyevu's greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail clothes selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 35,000 KES, she wants to purchase 60 sacks of charcoal and 20 pairs of Khangas for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 60 sacks of charcoal and 20 pairs of Khangas for sale.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Anta, perteneciente a la provincia D. Anta,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 71 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. queso, ella venD. en la provincia D. Limatambo y también se dedica a la agricultura donD. siembra maíz y papa y luego lo venD. en las distintas ferias que existe, la socia prepara los quesos y lo venD. en forma ambulatoria, por medio D. estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. queso y mejorar el negocio  D. agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar los quesos como leche y también para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras D. agricultura.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 71, belongs to the “Mujeres en Accion” (Women in Action) communal bank located in Anta District that belongs to Anta Province and Cusco Department.

She is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily chores with a cheese selling business.  She sells in Limatambo Province and she’s also a farmer that grows corn and potatoes that are later sold in the various markets that take place.  She is a street vendor of delicious cheeses she makes.  Through these small businesses she’s able to move her children forward.  She’d like to expand the cheese selling business and improve her farming so is asking for a loan to buy cheese making supplies, like milk, and also to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland.

She is happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy cheese making supplies and to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Pili, who is in her late 30s, is married and has one child who still goes to school. She has been running a cosmetics business for one and a half years. She works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Pili's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more cosmetics and has repaid all her loans successfully. Pili hopes for a loan to increase her cosmetics stock. Her dream is to one day be able to buy land.

Pili will share this loan with her loan group "Ustawi" which consists of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To increase her cosmetics stock

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a single woman who lives in her own house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is medical bills.

For the past ten years, Joice has operated a scrap metal sales business, selling to local neighbors. She also earns additional income by selling cereals and owning real estate houses. Joice faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Joice plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase construction materials, such as cement and sand, to renovate her real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to renovate her real estate houses.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical bills.

For the past six years, Getrude has operated a cereals business. She also operates a vegetable stall as another source of income. Getrude faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business in the future.

Getrude plans to use this KES 60,000 loan to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El Sr. Enrique soltero, tiene 36 años de edad, de profesión electricista de vehículo hace mas de 12 años, vive en casa de sus padres, trabaja en forma independiente en el taller de su hermano quien también tiene la misma profesión.
Enrique cuenta que desde pequeño empezó a trabajar en eso y que a medida que pasaba el tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia y ganando confianza en sí mismo para poder independizarse, gracias a eso tiene una clientela bien formada.
El se define como una persona muy trabajdora y sacrificada, ya que su trabajo requiere de mucho esfuerzo, no solo físico sino también mental.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas para el negocio. El objetivo que tiene es de tener su propio taller de electricidad ya que eso le ayudará a generar más ingreso.
texts.en:
Enrique, 36, is single.  He is a vehicle electrical systems specialist by profession; he’s been in this occupation for over 12 years.  He lives in his parents’ house and works independently in his brother’s shop who is in the same occupation.

Enrique relates that he started working in this since he was little and as time went by he acquired more experience and trust in his abilities to become independent.  Thanks to this he has a well established clientele.

He defines himself as a very hard working, dedicated individual because his work requires a lot of effort, not just physical but mental too.

He asked for the loan to buy work tools.  The goal he has is to have his own electrical shop because that would help him generate more income.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Kaidu

texts.fr: Moussa est le membre qui représenter coopérative KAIDU client d’ACB Depuis 2009  (Kaidu est une coopérative qui distribue les aliments dans les institutions tels que prisons, des écoles,…). Représenter par  Moussa, il a 39 ans, il est marié, et il a 2 enfants entre 5 ans et 16 ans.  Tous vont à l’école.  Il est né au Rwanda, et il a niveau d’éducation de 6 ans des études secondaire (A2).  Ce crédit est son premier  cycle avec ACB. Ils vont utiliser leur prêt pour acheter des produits agricole pour les revendre à l’un des écoles qui se trouve dans leur district .  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est être plus productif en utilisant le grain bien sélectionne, cherché autre marché pour distribuer les produit des ses  champs.  Il voudrait  fonder des usines dans le future, avoir les machines pour lui aider avec son activité, et avoir des vaches au moins pour chaque membre du groupe.  Pour sa famille il voudrait payer le minerval pour ses enfants jusqu’au niveau supérieur.
texts.en: Moussa is the representative member of the Kaidu C., a client of ACB since 2009 (Kaidu is a C. that distributes food to institutions like prisons, schools, …). Moussa is 39 years old and married and has two children between 5 and 16 years old. They both attend school. He was born in Rwanda and has had 6 years of secondary school education. This loan is his first with ACB. They are going to use their loan to buy agricultural products to sell to one of the schools in their district. His strategy to expand his business is to be more productive by using well-chosen grain and to find another market to distribute his field products. He would like to open factories in the future, to have machines to help with his business, and to have cows at least for each member of the group. For his family, he would like to pay for his children’s education through college.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products to sell to one of the schools in their district

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Sabino; el tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el hace servicio urbano público, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el hace servicio desde el cusco e izcuchaca,el socio por medio de este negocio de transporte saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de transporte y quiere de terminar de construir su casa ,el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi en la ruta de Izcuchaca-Cusco,el socio también. El  socio solicita el préstamo para compara materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, piedras y yeso para terminar de construir su casa. 
                                            
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabino, 37, belongs to the “Mujeres en Accion” (Women in Action) communal bank located in Anta District that belongs to Anta Province and Cusco Department.

He has a spouse and three children.  He alternates his daily chores with providing transportation services.  He provides urban public transportation service.  He works from 7am until 10pm on the Cusco-Izcuchaca route.  Through the transportation business he’s able to support his children.  He wants to expand the transportation service and to finish building his house.  He also has a car providing taxi service along the Izcuchaca-Cusco route.  He is asking for the loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, sand, stone and plaster to finish building his house.

He is happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de queso, yogurt y manjar, ella prepara estos productos y lo vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Huancaro en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia vende los días sábados y los otros días se dedica a la ganadería, ella compra y vende ganados, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos lácteos y ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar 2 vacas pequeñas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nancy, 38, belongs to the “Mujeres en Accion” (Women in Action) communal bank located in Anta District that belongs to Anta Province and Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and four children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling cheese, yoghurt and manjar (caramel).  She makes these products and sells them in the city of Cusco’s Huancaro market.  She sells on Saturdays.  The rest of the days she spends raising livestock.  She is a livestock merchant.  She’s able to support her children with these businesses.  She wants to expand the dairy products business and enlarge the livestock sales and is asking for a loan to buy two small cows.

She is happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy two small cows.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical bills.

For the past 10 years, Susan has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is price fluctuations in the business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

Susan plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of washing soaps, detergents, wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of washing soaps, detergents, wheat flour, maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Maïmouna's Group

texts.fr: Mariée, Maïmouna vit avec ses 5 enfants et son mari en location à Zogbo, un quartier populeux de Cotonou la capitale du Bénin. Tous les enfants du couple sont scolarisés et pour les charges relatives à leur scolarité et autres, le couple participe ensemble. Maïmouna une commerçante. Elle vend diverses variétés de céréales, la boisson traditionnelle communément appelée SODABI et les condiments à son domicile. Elle fait des ventes en gros et en détails à ses clients se trouvant dans sa zone commerciale et ses environs. La cliente s'approvisionne dans quelques villages du Bénin, à savoir Adja Azovè, Houègbo, Glo où les coûts des produits sont relativement plus abordables. Pour augmenter la taille de son activité afin de jouir d'une autonomie financière, Maïmouna a sollicité et obtenu le renouvellement de son crédit à FINADEV (elle est à son 2ème crédit). Le revenu généré par ce prêt lui permettra d'être indépendante financièrement et de couvrir certaines charges familiales. Elle souhaiterait s'acheter une parcelle et construire une maison, pour le bonheur de toute sa famille Maïmouna, chef du groupe, en tenue traditionnelle communément appelée Boba, de couleur belge fleurie et positionnée à droite sur la photo, s'est associée à Mme Jacqueline A, elle aussi commerçante à Cotonou. Les deux forment un groupe solidaire très appréciable.
texts.en: A married woman, Maïmouna rents a place with her five children and husband in Zogbo, a populous district of Cotonou, the capital of Benin. The couple’s children are all in school. As for the cost of schooling and other costs, the couple covers them jointly. Maïmouna is a merchant. She sells a variety of grains, the traditional drink commonly called sodabi, and some condiments out of her home. She makes her sales retail and wholesale to customers found in her commercial district and nearby. Our client stocks up in a few villages in Benin, namely Adja Azovè, Houègbo, and Glo where the cost of goods is relatively affordable. To increase the size of her business in order to enjoy some financial autonomy, she has requested and obtained the renewal of her loan at FINADEV (she is on her second loan). The revenues generated by this loan will enable her to be financially independent and to cover certain family expenses. She would like to buy a plot of land and build a house for the sake of her entire family. Maïmouna is the head of the group. In the photo, she is at the right and wearing traditional clothing called a boba with beige flowers. She is joined by Ms. Jacqueline A, who is also a merchant in Cotonou. The two comprise an appreciable solidarity group.

loans.use: to buy fifteen 100-kg sacks of grains, two containers of sodabi, and also three baskets of tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcelino de 47 años de edad es electricista de vehículo hace mas de 17 años, vive con su esposa en domicilio propio donde tiene montado su taller de electricidad del automóvil, tiene tres hijos todos en edades escolares.
Don Marcelino cuenta con buena clientela gracias a la experiencia de varios años adquiridos en dicha actividad laboral, con lo cual  mantiene a su familia junto con su señora quien tiene una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, lo cual genera un ingreso diario para la alimentación de sus hijos.
El se considera un hombre muy trabajador y luchador. Sabe que el trabajo es la única forma de salir adelante.  Sueña con poder tener un gran salón donde poner los autos que repara.
El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de repuesto para su posterior venta. Su objetivo en la vida es de ver crecer y formarse como persona a sus hijos y poder llegar a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 47 years old and has been an automobile electrician for more than 17 years.  He lives with his wife in a home of his own, where he has his workshop.  He has three school-aged children.

Marcelino has steady customers, thanks to several years experience.  He supports his family this way and his wife also has a small food store that she runs out of the home.  This generates a daily income so that they can feed their children.  He considers himself to be a hard working man who puts forth a great deal of effort.  He knows that work is the only way to get ahead and he dreams of having a large auto shop where he can repair cars.

He will use the money from this loan to buy replacement parts to resell.  His life’s objective is to watch his children grow and strengthen themselves as individuals to be able to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy auto parts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío es natural de Sicaya y en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa que es propia. La actividad que se dedica es la crianza de ovejas, cerdos y toros, animales que cuida y alimenta diariamente con alfalfa. Siendo este producto que siembra en terrenos que alquiló. Durante el fin de semana vende los animales y comprar otros más jóvenes y a un bajo precio para engordarlos para luego ser ofertados a un precio mayor. Otros de los productos que siembra es el maíz, pues lo hace secar al sol para venderlos desgranados en la feria local de su zona, del mismo modo vende también alfalfa. Es así como trabaja para tener ganancias y cubrir las necesidades de su familia. El sueño de Rocío es tener una granja grande de animales menores y producir mayores  extensiones de terreno en alfalfa y maíz. Tiene amplia experiencia de trabajo solidario ya que es una de las socias antiguas de su banco comunal y tiene lecciones aprendidas que le han servido mucho en su vida diaria, es responsable en sus pagos porque considera que ser puntual te abre muchas puertas. En esta ocasión el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas.
texts.en:
Rocío is from Sicaya and currently lives with her husband and four children in a house of her own.  She raises sheep, pigs and bulls, animals that she cares for and feeds alfalfa to, that she grows on leased lands, daily.  On weekends she sells the animals and buys younger ones at a lower price to fatten up and then sell at higher prices.  One of the other things she grows is corn that she has dry in the sun to sell hulled in a local market; she also sells alfalfa.  This is how she works to have profits to cover family’s needs.  Rocío’s dream is to have a larger farm and to grow larger expanses of alfalfa and corn.

She has quite a bit of experience working in solidarity groups because she’s one of the most longstanding members of her communal bank and she’s learned lessons that have helped her a lot in her daily life.  She’s responsible with her payments because she feels that being punctual opens up many doors.  On this occasion she will use the money she’s asking for to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business in the future.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase building materials, cement, and sand. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase building materials, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a married woman with five children. Four of her children attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a retail business selling spare parts to bicycle operators. She also operates a clothes selling business, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her shop to a hardware shop in the future.

With the 70,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of bicycle spare parts and clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of bicycle spare parts and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Segundo Exequiel

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 24 años de edad  y vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Saqa en Lambayeque. Goza de buenas referencias personales por parte de sus vecinos.

Segundo es un joven emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años. Actualmente, está sembrando maíz y solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes y hacer las labores de deshierbo respectivas.

Segundo tiene muchos deseos de superación. Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres y hacer arreglos dentro de su hogar. Este préstamo le sería de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Segundo, 24, lives in his parents’ house in Saga District in Lambayeque.  He has good personal references from his neighbors. 

Segundo is an enterprising, hard working young man who has been farming for the last five years.  At present, he’s growing corn and asks Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy fertilizer and to carry out the respective weeding chores.

Segundo very much wants to get ahead in life.  He wants to improve his parents’ quality of life and to do some home improvements.  This loan will be of great use to him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Elsa Beatriz

texts.es:
La  Sra. Elsa es D. la ciudad D. Santani, tiene 46 años D. edad, está casada con el Sr. Eleuterio D. 49 años D. edad, tienen 2 Hijos, todos mayores D. edad, los cuales trabajan D. forma independiente.
Se dedica a la venta ambulante D. Artículos D. Mercerías, comenta que tiene una clientela bien formada, lo cual le genera un buen ingreso. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Por medio del trabajo que ella hace ha logrado mantener a sus hijos y D. paso ayuda a su marido en los gastos D. la casa. Dice que su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos sigan una carrera universitaria y se vuelvan buenos profesionales.
El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra D. artículos D. mercería, como ser cubiertos, ropas, souvenires y demás. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Elsa is from Santaní.  She’s 46 years old and is married to Eleuterio, 49.  They have two children who are both adults and work independently.

She is a general merchandise vendor.  She comments that she has a well formed clientele which generates a good income.  She defines herself as a very hard working, enterprising woman.  Through her work she’s managed to support her children and along the way has helped her husband cover household expenses.  She says that her greatest wish is that her children study university careers and become good professionals.

She is asking for the loan to buy general merchandise like: cutlery, clothes, souvenirs, etc.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it provides her.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo. Ella y su familia viven en casa propia ubicada en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande en Piura.

Norma se dedica a la  crianza y venta  de aves de corral y de porcinos. Ella comercializa sus animales en el mercado de la comunidad y a pesar de la competencia, cuenta con una clientela establecida. Norma desarrolla esta actividad desde hace 5 años.

Su esposo es agricultor y también brinda servicios de transporte público (mototaxi), él ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa y tiene un buen historial crediticio. 

Norma desea crecer en su actividad y solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado a sus animales. Esto hará que tengan un mejor tamaño y peso y Norma los pueda vender a mayores precios.
texts.en:
Norma, 41, is married and has a son.  She and her family live in their own house located in the rural part of Tambogrande in Piura.

Norma raises barnyard fowl and pigs.  She sells her animals in the local market and despite competition has a well established clientele.  Norma has been in this line of work for five years.

Her husband’s a farmer and also provides public transportation services (mototaxi).  He has worked with Edpyme Alternativa and has a good credit history.

Norma wants to grow in her activity and is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals.  This will cause them to reach better size and weight and Norma will be able to sell them for higher prices.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José tiene 35 años de edad, está casado y vive en casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Mochumi. José vive en la parte rural de este.

La actividad que desarrolla es la venta de abarrotes, en el interior de su hogar. Así como, la crianza y venta de animales que realiza desde hace 11 años lo que le ha dado gran experiencia y clientela.

José solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar abarrotes para surtir su negocio. También comprará animales y alimento balanceado para ellos, para crecer en su segundo negocio.

José es un cliente antiguo de nuestra institución y cuenta con un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old, married and lives in his own house located in Mochumí District.  José lives in the rural part of it.

José’s activity is selling groceries at home.  He also raises animals to sell.  He’s been doing this for the last 11 years and it’s given him great experience and clientele.

José is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy groceries to stock his store.  He will also buy animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them to expand his second business.

José is a longstanding client of our institution and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy groceries and animals to raise.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a widowed woman with 10 children. Six of her children still attend school and four have graduated. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a business selling charcoal at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to become a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 30 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old and lives in the city of Otavalo in northern Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband and their children. Her children are aged nine and four. 

Rosa is a serious person. She is also hard-working and responsible. In her business, she makes children’s pajamas. She began her own business three years ago with the intention of working to support her children while being able to keep them by her side as she worked. This is Rosa’s first loan and she will use it to invest in cloth for her business. She hopes that the loan will help her to economically provide for the well-being of her children. In the future, Rosa wants to expand her business and employ others.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to make children's pajamas.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with two children. One of her children attends school and one is underage. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business selling at retail to her local neighbors. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish real estate houses in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase a motorcycle for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de familia de 2 niños y su esposo es agricultor. Esta es una familia muy unida y trabajadora que tiene muchos deseos de superación. Viven en el distrito de Mórrope  en Lambayeque.

Bertha se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Actualmente cuenta con un ganado vacuno y ovino. Ella tiene una experiencia de 6 años en su actividad lo que le ha permitido desarrollar su negocio y ganar clientela.
 
Bertha cría sus animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado a sus ganados para que estos tengan un adecuado crecimiento.

Bertha tiene muchos deseos de mejorar sus ventas para poder comprar más animales y así crecer en su negocio y llevar una mejor calidad de vida. 

Este préstamo le sería de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Bertha is 36 years old. She is the mother of 2 children, and her husband is a farmer. This is a very close and hardworking family that has a great desire to overcome. They live in the district of Mórrope in Lambayeque.

Bertha raises and sells animals. She currently has a herd of cattle and sheep. She has 6 years of experience in her business, which has allowed her to develop her business and gain clients.

Bertha raises her animals in the area behind her house. She has requested from Edypme Alternativa a loan of PEN 700.00 to buy feed for her animals so they can grow well.

Bertha has a great desire to improve her sales so she can buy more animals and grow her business and have a better quality of life. 

This loan would be of great use to her.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single mother of four children, all of whom have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a retail shop business selling household commodities. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to start a constructions supplies business, purchase construction supplies of cement and sand. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies of cement and sand.

loans.name: Karol Lizet

texts.es:
Karol  tiene 23 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora que vive en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, en una casa propia. La casa de Karol no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, solo tiene luz.

Karol se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual realiza recorriendo las comunidades pequeñas que se encuentran alrededor de la suya. Sus ventas las realiza a clientes conocidos. 

Además, Karol tiene  un segundo  negocio de venta de cerveza, que realiza los fines de semana. Karol cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres en ambas actividades y tiene muchos deseos de seguir superándose.

Karol solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar ropa  para sus ventas. También invertirá en su otro negocio, comprando cerveza para abastecerlo.
 
Ella estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el préstamo pues le sería de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Karol, 23, is a young entrepreneur living in the rural part of Tambogrande-Piura in her own house.  Karol’s house does not have all basic utilities; it only has electricity.

Karol sells clothes going throughout the small communities that are located around hers.  She sells to customers that are well-known to her.

Karol has a second business: beer sales that take place on weekends.  Karol’s parents help her out with both activities and she has a strong desire to continue improving.

Karol is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to buy clothes to sell.  She will also invest in her other business buying beer to stock it.

She is very grateful for having this loan granted to her because it will be of great use to her.

loans.use: to buy clothes and beer.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en casa familiar, en una comunidad pequeña en vías de desarrollo, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque.

Victoria se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, etc.) en una bodega ubicada en el interior de su domicilio. Ella cuenta con una de las bodegas más surtidas de su comunidad y realiza ventas al contado y al crédito.

Victoria tiene clientela establecida y este negocio le ha traído grandes satisfacciones por lo que desea seguir invirtiendo en él. Es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de los productos que tienen gran demanda en su bodega.

Victoria ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y ha cancelado puntual y responsablemente sus cuotas. Este préstamo le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is 25 years old, a single mother and lives in her family home in a small developing community 20 minutes from the city of Lambayeque.

Victoria sells groceries (rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.) from a shop in her home. She has one of the best-stocked shops in the community and sells for cash or on credit.

Victoria has an established clientele, and this business has brought her great satisfaction, so she wants to continue investing in it. This is why she is requesting a loan of 1000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a greater quantity of the products in her shop for which there is high-demand.

Victoria has already worked with our institution and has punctually and responsibly made her payments. This loan will allow her to continue growing her business.

loans.use: To buy groceries to stock her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina tiene 61 años, es una mujer carismática y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Benjamín de 66 años y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. Cristina con su arduo trabajo sacó adelante a sus queridos hijos, quienes hoy la agradecen por su apoyo brindado. Ella desde muy joven se independizó de sus padres y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia vendiendo variedad de frutas de la costa, sierra y selva, su puesto esta situado en el mercado principal de la ciudad de San Francisco, ella es una vendedora muy carismática y persuasiva, motivo por el cual tiene muchos clientes, quienes no dudan de  la calidad de sus frutas y optan en comprarle la mayor parte de su mercadería. Menciona que la agrada dialogar con sus compañeras de venta, ya que así siente que sus días de trabajo sean amenos, lleva 25 años en este negocio y considera que lo complicado es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día en espera de clientes. Cristina agradece a todos ustedes por depositar su confianza en ella, ya que gracias al apoyo de ellos trata de mejorar su condición de vida. Con el monto solicitado comprará mas frutas para implementar su quiosco de ventas. Para el bien de su futuro espera contar con la misma fuerza y agradece a dios por mantenerla sana y salva. Este es su 13avo crédito con MFP y espera de un pequeño préstamo por parte de ustedes para poder cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en sus anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más fruta para efectuar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Cristina, 61, is a charismatic, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Benjamín, 66, and what she most wants is to live a peaceful old age.  Through hard work Cristina was able to raise her beloved children who today appreciate the support she gave them.  From a very early age she became independent from her parents and started working on her own selling a variety of fruit from the coast, highlands and jungle.  

Her stand is located in the city of San Francisco’s main market.  She is a charismatic and persuasive vendor which has led to a large clientele who do not question the quality of her fruit and opt to buy most of her merchandise.  She mentions that she enjoys chatting with her fellow vendors because that makes her work days more pleasant.  She’s been in business 25 years and considers the most complicated part having to remain standing throughout the day awaiting customers.  

Cristina thanks all of you for the trust placed in her because, thanks to support from them, she attempts to improve her living conditions.  For her future wellbeing she hopes to have the same strength and thanks God for keeping her safe and sound.

This is her 13th loan with MFP and she hopes for a small loan from you to be able to reach her goals.  On the other hand, she commits to pay her installments like she’s done in her previous loans.  She is a member of her communal bank who is very committed to her fellow members’ development.  She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more fruit to better stock her sales stand.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to stock her fruit stand.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and lives near the city of Latacunga in central Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband and their two children, aged 9 years and 5 years. 

Rosa is a very open person although she is also a little shy. Rosa works as a farmer alongside her husband. She began working twenty years ago with four chickens and has expanded her business since then. 

This is Rosa’s first loan and she will use it to buy chickens. She believes that this loan will help her family improve in every sense to attain a higher quality of life. Rosa’s dreams for the future including owning her own store and health and a good future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Segundo Agapito

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 58 años de edad y es padre de  3 hijos. Segundo y su familia viven en una comunidad urbana y pequeña perteneciente al distrito de Lagunas en Chiclayo. En esta comunidad se dedican al comercio y a la prestación de servicios, principalmente.

Segundo es una persona que goza de buenas referencias por ser trabajador. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte público y actualmente cuenta con una unidad vehicular.

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para reparar el motor de su auto y darle mantenimiento al resto de la unidad, para poder seguir brindando sus servicios.

Este crédito le es sumamente importante porque no podrá realizar su trabajo si su vehículo sigue dañado. Segundo desea mejorar el servicio a sus pasajeros para mantenerlos y aumentar su demanda.
texts.en:
Segundo is 58 years old and father of 3 children. Segundo and his family live in a small urban community in the district of Lagunas in Chiclayo. In this community, people work principally in trade and services.

Segundo is a person who has good references because he is a hard worker. Since the age of 15 he has been providing transport services and currently owns a vehicle.

He is requesting a loan of 3000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to repair the motor of his car and for maintenance of the rest of the vehicle in order to be able to continue providing his services.

This loan is extremely important, because he will not be able to do his work if his vehicle is damaged. Segundo wishes to improve the service to his passengers in order to keep them and increase demand.

loans.use: to repair the motor and for general maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Linlingnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement LINLINGNON est composé de trente membres qui vivent tous dans la même localité et qui mènent certaines activités ensemble. La présidente de ce groupement du nom de Étiennette, est celle qui a une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Étiennette est une veuve ayant quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un n'est plus à sa charge. Étiennette vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Étiennette n’a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Étiennette mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d'année, la production d'huile de palme et de farine de manioc, qu'elle vend dans sa région. Étiennette s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter sa production et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, Étiennette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement LINLINGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira ainsi à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The group LINLINGNON is made up of thirty members who all live in the same locality and do certain activities together. The president of this group, called Étiennette, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. In order to raise the level of their businesses so that they can better respond to the demand of their clientele. this group is requesting their first-ever loan from ALIDé. 

Étiennette is a widow with four children, all enrolled in school. One of them is no longer her responsibility. She lives alone with her children and covers their living expenses. 

Étiennette only went to primary school. To support herself and her children, she has been producing palm oil and manioc flour for about 15 years now. She sells her products in her region. She buys her supplies in Bénin. 

In order to increase her production and better respond to the needs of her ever-growing client base, Étiennette is requesting, together with the other members of the group LINLINGNON, her first loan from ALIDé. This loan will help them to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy palm fruit and manioc.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo tiene 28 años, es un joven emprendedor vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro, y por ello se esfuerza en trabajar constantemente. Eduardo, tiene estudios inconclusos en computación y con la poca experiencia que adquirió de sus estudios, hoy pone esos conocimientos en su puesto de servicios donde ofrece servicio de Internet, juegos en red y mantenimiento de computadoras, negocio donde atiende amablemente a sus concurrentes. Lleva 03 años realizando esta actividad y se siente bien con su negocio y considera que sus ingresos le son muy favorables porque gracias a ello esta creciendo y de a pocos va implementando su tienda. Eduardo necesita el apoyo crediticio para seguir avanzando y  prosperando. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar las instalaciones de las cabinas de Internet, para poder brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es su crédito 03 y por ende necesita el apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir creciendo. En su banco comunal es un socio participe y solidario. Con los 1,000 mil nuevos soles solicitados, planea comprar monitores, estabilizadores y algunos programas educativos para el bien de sus usuarios.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 28, is a young entrepreneur living in his parents house.  What he most wants is to forge a future for himself and this is why tries to work hard constantly.  Eduardo hasn’t completed his training in computers but he’s putting what skills he has acquired and his limited experience to use in a stand providing Internet access service, online gaming and computer repair, a business where he cordially takes care of his customers.

He’s been in business three years and he feels good about the business and feels that the earnings from it are favorable because thanks to them he’s been growing and gradually furnishing the store.

Eduardo needs financial help to continue to grow and make progress.  In time, he wants to improve the Internet access booths to provide better customer service.

This is his 3rd loan and he needs support from all of you to be able to continue to grow.  He is a participative and supportive member of his communal bank.  He will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy monitors, voltage regulators and some educational programs for his customers’ wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy monitors, voltage regulators and educational games.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electrical appliances to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 27 years old and lives near the city of Latacunga in central Ecuador. She is separated from her husband and lives with her parents. Yolanda has two children aged seven and six. 

Yolanda is a person of strong character; she is very responsible, and is dedicated to her activities. Yolanda works selling "Yanbal", a cosmetics brand selling make-up, cologne, and perfumes. This is Yolanda’s first loan and she will use it to invest in "Yanbal" cosmetics. She believes her loan will help her with her income and with the well-being of her family. 

Yolanda’s future goal is to have her own "Yanbal" store. She also dreams that her children will get a better education than she did and that their education will allow them to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in "Yanbal" brand cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.en: Julio Cesar is 45 years old and lives with his partner. He has three children, all of whom still live in his house and attend school. His occupation is selling crafts in all parts of Cusco city. Specifically he sells dolls, blankets, and knitted hats. Julio Cesar is asking for a 200 USD loan in order to purchase more dolls, blankets, and knitted hats to sell. He is committed to expanding his business and promises to make all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more crafts to sell (dolls, blankets, and knitted hats)

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela  tiene 41 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa, junto a su esposo Jorge de 41 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Marion de 14 y Jorge de 07 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Graciela trabaja arduamente para educar a sus queridos hijos quienes vienen cursando el nivel primario y secundario en distintas Instituciones Educativas. Graciela tiene su puesto de ventas en la ciudad de San Francisco donde ofrece variedad de víveres como arroz, azúcar y variedad de bebidas, ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable y está muy bien ubicada, justo en la calle principal de su ciudad. Desde muy tempranas horas abre las puertas de su negocio en espera de sus primeros compradores quienes sabiendo de la variedad de sus mercadería no dudan en llevar lo necesario para la vianda familiar. Lleva 06 años en este negocio y menciona que le va muy bien ya que gracias a ello pudo adquirir muchos bienes para su hogar. Con el crédito solicitado comprará suministros en cantidad para su puesto de ventas. Con el tiempo, espera mejorar su tienda y hacerla crecer, para así poder prestar mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este será su sexto crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de ustedes para seguir prosperando y por ello se compromete ser puntual en sus pagos. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de los integrantes. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Graciela, 41, is a kind, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Jorge, 41, and their two beloved children, Marion, 14, and Jorge, 7, who are the main motivators of all her efforts.  Graciela works hard to educate her beloved children who are in elementary and secondary school in different educational institutions. 

Graciela has a sales stand in the city of San Francisco where she stocks a variety of foodstuffs like rice, sugar and a selection of beverages.  She is happy with her business because it’s quite profitable and well located precisely on the city’s main street.  She opens her doors for business very early awaiting her first customers who, knowing about the variety of merchandise, don’t hesitate to take what they need for their family meals.  She’s been in business six years and she mentions that she does very well because thanks to it she’s been able to purchase many good for her home.

She will use the requested loan to buy stock items in bulk for her sales stand.  In time, she hopes to improve the store and make it grow to provide better service to her customers.  

This will be her 6th loan and she’s very happy to know that once again she’ll have support from you to continue making progress and she, therefore, commits to be very punctual with her payments.  She is very well liked by the other members of the communal bank.  She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more stock items for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos lacteos,ella vende queso y leche, ella prepara queso y lo vende en forma ambulatoria los días sábados en el mercado de la ciudad de Cusco ya que Anta queda  a 30 minutos de Cusco, la socia también se dedica a la agricultura, ella cultiva papa, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de queso y venta de papa, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de queso y venta de papa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los quesos como leche.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Gregoria is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres en Acción” (Women in Action) which is located in the District and Province of Anta, Department of Cusco.

She is 46 years old, married, and has five children. Gregoria divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling dairy products. She sells cheese and milk. Gregoria prepares the cheese and sells it as a street vendor on Saturdays at the market in the city of Cusco. Anta is 30 minutes away from Cusco. Gregoria is also a farmer who grows potatoes. Through these small businesses, Gregoria is able to move forward on behalf of her children. She wants to expand her business of selling cheese and potatoes so that her children can get ahead.

Gregoria wants to improve her business of selling cheese and potatoes. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making cheese, such as milk.

Gregoria is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making cheese.

loans.name: Lucia Pabla

texts.es: Lucia vive en L. ciudad D. BarranquilL. con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades D. 20 y 16 años respectivamente; allí tiene su negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza, D. ropa y calzado en todas las líneas, el cual inició para apoyar L. gestión D. su esposo en el hogar, mediante L. generación D. ingresos independientes en un trabajo autónomo, que permitiera  responder D. manera simultánea a sus compromisos como madre y esposa.  Lucia en su negocio venD. mediante crédito, otorgando plazos pactados con sus clientes D. acuerdo con sus ingresos y es por esto que  su negocio goza D. gran aceptación D. parte D. ellos. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará una vitrina y L. surtirá con mercancías, que aún tiene guardadas en cajas y también comprará artículos D. belleza que han encargado sus clientes y con ellos sería oportuna en dar respuesta. Su mayor fortaleza es su experiencia y su capacidad D. servicio, lo cual pronostica una inversión exitosa además D. que está hecha sobre pedidos D. clientes ya conocidos. Su mayor desafío es tener casa propia y ya ha accedido al programa D. construcción D. comunidades sostenibles, liderado por L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en Villas D. San Pablo, ubicado en L. ciudad D. BarranquilL.., con el cual se siente ilusionada  por llegar a  tener el subsidio D. vivienda tan anhelado
texts.en:
Lucia lives in the city of BarranquilL. with her husband and two children, ages 20 and 16 respectively. There she has a business selling beauty products, clothing, and shoes of all brands. She started this business with the intention of helping her husband with the household expenses and generating some self-employment income while fulfilling her responsibilities as a wife and mother. In her business, Lucia extends credit to her customers with terms that are based according to income level. This explains why her business has gained wiD. acceptance. This Kiva loan is her second occurrence of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to buy a display cabinet and to restock with more merchandise. At the moment, everything is kept in boxes. She also plans to buy beauty products that her customers have ordered, so she wants to be able to fulfill their requests. Lucia’s greatest strengths are her experience and her ability to proviD. service, which are good indicators of a successful investment as evident by the many orders she has received from her existing customers.

Her greatest challenge is acquiring her own home, so she has already applied for the Construction Program of Sustainable Communities which is headed by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in Villas D. San Pablo, located in the city of BarranquilL.. Lucia is excited about receiving a housing subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a display cabinet and various types of merchandise to restock her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is 75 years old and married with seven children, all of whom live separately from her. She is the owner of a small grocery store that sells all types of soft drinks, snacks, beers, and other necessities. In addition, she also sells food at a local market that takes place every Saturday. She has to get up very early in the morning to make her food and be at the market by 7 a.m. Juana is asking for a $300 loan to buy more supplies for her grocery store. She plans to buy more sugar, rice, flour, and beer. She is a hardworking woman and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, and beer for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to supplement a government loan to purchase a home.

loans.name: Mahutin Cocotomey Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUTIN COCOTOMEY est composé de cinq membres qui fréquentent la même Église. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Françoise est celle qui à une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Françoise est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin. Françoise est mariée à un certain Germain. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Françoise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Françoise a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Françoise mène comme activité depuis huit ans environs, la vente du maïs, de la farine de blé et du sucre. Françoise s'approvisionne dans l'un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Françoise et les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN COCOTOMEY sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The group MAHUTIN COCOTOMEY is composed of five members who attend the same church. The group representative is named Françoise and she is raising her hand in the photo.  In order to grow the level of their activity and better respond to the demand of their clientele, this group is requesting their first loan from  ALIDé. 

Françoise, 44, lives in Bénin. She is married to Germain. The couple have four children, all enrolled in school and all under their roof. Françoise lives with her husband and children. She attended school only for a short while. To support herself and her children, Françoise has been selling maize, wheat flour and sugar for about eight years. She buys her supplies at one of the biggest markets in Bénin. 

In order to expand their businesses and better satisfy their clientele, Françoise and the other members of the MAHUTIN COCOTOMEY group are requesting a loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to grow the level of their business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize, wheat flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, rice and toiletries in higher volume.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Paulino; el tiene 53 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura y ganadería, el es propietario de unas tierras de cultivo donde siembra papa y maíz y también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, ella vende el ganado en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas para su tierra de cultivo y una vaca.
                                            
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulino, 53, belongs to the “Mujeres en Acción” (Women in Action) communal bank located in Anta District that belongs to Anta Province and Cusco Department.

Paulino is married and has five children.  He alternates his daily chores with farming and raising livestock.  He owns some farmland where he grows potatoes and corn and he also is a livestock merchant.  He sells livestock at the various markets that take place in Anta district.  He is able to support his children through these businesses.  He is asking for a loan to buy seed for his farmland and to buy a cow.

He’s happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to buy a cow.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila tiene 57 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Samuel de 53 años y su querido hijo Bryan de 16 años, a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Lucila a base de trabajo y perseverancia logró situar su negocio en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde hoy su ferretería es una de la más conocida y visitada de la ciudad, debido a la gran variedad de productos que tiene en venta. Ella se esfuerza por tener su negocio bien surtido, es por ello que cada fin de mes viaja a la ciudad de Lima a comprar los materiales que se agotaron. Considera que le agrada ayudar a sus clientes a elegir los mejores productos para sus construcciones, lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y menciona que lo más difícil es tener que cargar los pesados materiales que trae desde la capital, pero aun así ella sigue firme en sus metas. Con el crédito solicitado comprará materiales de construcción como clavos, fierros y calaminas. Con el tiempo desea, ampliar las instalaciones de su ferretería, para poderle brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es el 11avo crédito con MFP y espera el apoyo de ustedes para llevar a cabo su propósito, además se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia jovial y siempre está pendiente sobre los acuerdos del grupo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, viajará a la ciudad de Lima a comprar más materiales de construcción para implementar su ferretería.
texts.en:
Lucila is 57 years old.  She’s an unassuming, hard working woman living in her own house together with her husband, Samuel, 53, and her beloved son, Bryan, 16, who she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  Based on hard work and perseverance, Lucila managed to establish her business in the city of San Francisco.
