Today, her hardware store is one of the best known and most visited in the city due to the large variety of goods she stocks.  She strives to keep the business well stocked and this is why she travels to the city of Lima each week to buy the merchandise she’s run out of.  She enjoys helping her customers choose the best products for their construction projects.  She’s been in this line of work for 27 years and mentions that the most difficult part is having to carry the heavy materials she brings from the capital.  But, even so, she continues firm in her goals.

She will use the requested loan to buy building materials and supplies like nails, iron and plywood.  In time, she’d like to expand the hardware store’s facilities to provide a better service to her customers.

This is the 11th loan with MFP and she hopes to have support from all of you to reach her goals.  At the same time, she commits to repay her loan punctually.  She is a jovial member of the communal bank who is always aware of the agreements reached by the group.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more building materials and supplies to stock her hardware store.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to stock her hardware store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 30 years old and lives near the city of Latacunga in central Ecuador. She is single and lives with her three children aged 9, 7, and 5 years old. 

Alicia is a responsible and cheerful person. Whenever she has problems, she works until she finds the solution. Alicia works in the food service industry. She began her business two years ago. 

This is Alicia’s first loan and she will use it to invest in her business. She will purchase rice, sugar, and other foodstuffs. Alicia believes that the loan will change her life, her business, and allow her to give her children a better future. Her dream for her business is to continue to grow and eventually open a restaurant. Alicia’s dream for her children is that they get a good education.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana Patricia tiene 40 años, su actividad es la venta de productos varios. Tiene más de 9 años en la venta de bolsitas, golosinas, galletas, paletas entre otros.  Inicio este medio de vida con fondos propios, pues su esposo se encontraba enfermo fue así que ella decidió establecer un negocio que le proporcionara ingresos diariamente para su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de bolsas, frutas, azúcar leche, galletas entre otros productos. Sueña con incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Ana Patricia is 40 years old and sells various products. For more than 9 years she has sold little bags, sweets, cookies, lollipops and more. She started this business with her own funds, since her husband was sick, which is how she decided to establish a business that would provide daily income for her family. The financing she is seeking is to buy bags, fruit, sweetened milk and cookies as well as other products. She dreams of increasing her working capital.

loans.use: to buy bags, fruit, sweetened milk, cookies and other products.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 26-year-old married man with four children who are between one and eight years old. He lives in his own permanent house in Karuguuza, Uganda. For five years, Patrick has been in the motorcycle transport business. In addition, he operates a saloon. From these businesses, he has been able to buy a motorcycle. He faces the challenge of the high fluctuation of fuel prices but hopes to buy another motorcycle. Patrick wants a loan to top up and buy a second motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maritza; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es conviviente; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos y entre otros productos, ella vende en el distrito de Anta desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la tienda de abarrotes y comprar productos al por mayor como arroz, azúcar y fideos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The loan recipient is a member of the village bank "Mujeres en Accion" [Women in Action]. The bank is located in the district of Anta, which is in the province of Anta in the state of Cusco.

Maritza is 22 and lives with her partner. She runs a grocery store where she sells basic goods like rice, sugar, milk, noodles and other products. She sells in the district of Anta from 5:00am until 10:00pm. She wants to increase the size of her grocery store. She asks for a loan to stock the store and to buy products in bulk like rice, sugar and noodles.

She is happy about the loan and promises to meet her payment schedule.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with products purchased in bulk, like rice, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Filena De La Cruz

texts.es:
Doña Filena, desde hace nueve años, vende ropa nueva, cosmetico y utensilios escolares, negocio con el cual, ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos, y a su esposo con los gastos basico de agua y luz. Su esposo labora como cadete de su propio taxi, en donde junto han logrado un techo digno para sus hijos.
Filena comenzo  con dinero propio, y luego para invertir mas, lo hace atraves del prestamo en Afodenic, en donde ha crecido en inventario, y captacion de cliente.
En la venta de ropa, trabaja con creditos de quincena y tiene muchos pedidos, es por eso con este nuevo financiamiento sera para la compra de ropa, cosmeticos y utensilios escolares en variedad, tambien comprara una paca de ropa de cama, ya que son bonita y accesibles de precios, en el cual quiere probar como le va, con esta nueva inversion.con el proposito de obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
For 9 years, Filena has sold clothes, cosmetics and school supplies, a business that has allowed her to support her children and her husband and pay for basic needs like water and electricity. Her husband works as a driver in his own taxi, and together they have provided a worthy home for their children. Filena started with her own money, and later invested more through Afrodenic, which has increased her inventory and customer base.

For clothing sales, she works with 15 day credits and has a lot of orders, so this new loan will be used to buy clothing, cosmetics and various school supplies. She will also buy a bundle of bed sheets because they are pretty and affordable and she wants to see how this new investment will go, with the possibility of obtaining more income.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, school supplies and a pack of bed sheets to increase her sales.

loans.name: Margot

texts.en: Margot is 39 years old and lives with her partner. She has one daughter and one son, both of whom are still in school and living with her. She is the owner of a store in which she makes and sells curtains. Margot is asking for an $800 loan to buy more materials to make curtains. Specifically, she plans to purchase different kinds of fabric, cloth, and string. She is very proud of her business and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fabric, cloth, and string to make curtains

loans.name: Claudio Gerardo

texts.es:
Claudio Gerardo tiene 39 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 17,15 y 10 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Claudio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es tener dinero para ayudar  a los hijos.

Le gusta reunirse con la familia y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Claudio Gerardo is 39 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and his children who are 17, 15 and 10, in the canton of Ventanas in Provincia de los Ríos.

The members of the rural communal bank EL DIVINO NIÑO (The Divine Child) are located in the precinct of Estero Lindo in the canton of Ventanas. This loan group works in short-cycle agriculture, such as sowing corn and rice.

Claudio works in agriculture sowing corn and rice. He buys his products from the company AGRICPAC and sells them in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan in order to sow corn and rice, and purchase compost and corn and rice seeds. The support of the loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He faces challenges such as crop pests and the lack of money to hire more laborers. His dream is to have money to help his children.

He likes to spend time with the family and play sports.

loans.use: to buy corn and rice seeds and compost.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is 30 years old and married with six children between the ages of 1 and 13 years old. He lives in his own semi-permanent house in Karuguuza, Uganda. For five years, Jimmy has been dealing in the sale of local gin. From this business, he has been able to build a permanent house, which he is about to complete. He faces the challenge of the high rate of inflation but hopes to sell his local gin to bigger markets like the city where there is a local market. Jimmy needs a loan to buy local gin to sell.

loans.use: To buy local gin.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.es:
Edgardo tiene 42 años de edad, está casado y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Él vive en casa propia, con su familia, en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, en la parte rural de este. Su vivienda no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. 

Edgardo se dedica a la crianza  y venta de ganado ovino. Además, es agricultor y cuenta con terreno agrícola en donde siembra limón semanalmente. Su esposa lo apoya en sus actividades y existe una buena relación familiar que ha hecho que sus negocios prosperen

Edgardo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles  para comprar alimento balanceado a sus ovinos. Así como, fertilizantes para sus cultivos de limón y para realizar labores de deshierbo y poda de estos.

Este préstamo le permitirá seguir desarrollando su negocio adecuadamente y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edgardo is 42 years old, married and is raising 3 children. He lives in his own home, with his family, in the rural part of the district of Tambogrande – Piura. His home does not have all the basic services.

Edgardo raises and sells sheep. In addition, he is a farmer and has agricultural land where he sows lemons weekly. His wife supports him in these activities and they have a good familial relationship that has made their businesses prosper.

Edgardo is requesting a loan of 800 new Peruvian soles to buy balanced feed for his sheep as well as fertilizers for his lemon crops and for the labor for weeding and pruning them. 

This loan will allow him to continue adequately developing his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 38-year-old divorced woman with four children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to take care of the family rests on her and her dream is to educate her children up to university. She has been in retail with a charcoal shop for four years and she got her initial capital from selling clothes. Her hardship is the high commodity prices and her vision is a wholesale business plus building a house.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: La Presa De Enchisi Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LA PRESA DE ENCHISI" porque en la comunidad hay una presa y es más grande en esta epoca de lluvia, esta ubicado en Estado de Mexico. Es un lugar de gente muy trabajadora y dedicada a la produccion en el cultivo del campo con diferentes plantas. El grupo esta conformado por 10 personas y es la Primera vez que solicita un prestamo. La señora Esther es la presidenta del grupo, es casada y tiene 34 años de edad, con 6 hijos. Se dedica al cultivo y venta de nopales que inicio hace ya unos años, solicito el prestamo para comprar plastico y soldar la estructura de su invernadero para que su producto no se dañe. Su producto lo ofrece con sus vecinos ya que hay personas que no cultivan y le compran por mayoreo, la prefieren por que es de calidad y el esmero que le pone a su trabajo junto a su esposo e hijos que son sus principales motivos para trabajar dia a dia, ya que quiere que sus hijos sean unos grandes profesionistas.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Presa de Enchisi” (Enchisi Dam) because there is a dam in the community that is larger in the rainy season; it’s located in the State of México.  It is a place of hard working people dedicated to farming different plants.  The group has 10 members and this is the first time they’ve asked for a loan.

Esther is the group President.  She’s married and is 34 years old; she has six children.  She grows cactus paddles to sell, a business she started several years ago.  She asked for a loan to buy plastic and to weld the structure of her nursery so that her product won’t be damaged.  She sells her product to her neighbors because there are people who don’t grow it and buy it from her at wholesale.  They prefer hers because it’s good quality and because of the dedication she puts into her work with her husband and children who are the main motivators for her daily work because she wants her children to become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy plastic and to weld the structure of her nursery.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
Umu is 23 years old and single with no children. She runs a pharmacy in Lumley, near a neighborhood of Freetown. She takes care of three relatives. 

Umu has been in this business for three years and sells blood tonic, capsules and various types of medicine at her store.  She earns additional income from distributing soft drinks and bundles of water.  She says that the main challenges to her business are expired drugs and increasing shop rent.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase various types of medicines. Umu says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her savings. In the future, she would like to expand her business to various other districts.

loans.use: To purchase various types of medicines

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan  tiene 35 años de edad. El es un joven soltero y trabajador que vive con su madre y hermanos en la zona urbana del distrito de Motupe en Lambayeque.

Juan tiene su propio negocio de fabricación de adobes. Esta es una especie de ladrillo de barro, que es muy solicitada en la zona, pues la mayoría de casas están construidas con este material.

Juan es un joven trabajador y emprendedor que desea sacar adelante su negocio para poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar  los materiales necesarios para la fabricación de adobe. 

Juan es un cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad y este préstamo le sería de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old. This hardworking young man is single and lives with his mother and siblings in the urban section of the District of Motupe in Lambayeque.

Juan has his own business making adobe, a type of clay brick that is often requested in the area. Most of the houses in the area are built from this material.

Juan is a hardworking and enterprising young man who wants to succeed in his business so that he can improve his quality of life. He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can buy the necessary materials for making adobe.

Juan is a repeat client of Edpyme Alternativa and this loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy materials for making adobe bricks.

loans.name: Camilo Benigno

texts.es:
Camilo tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en la parte rural del  distrito de Las Lomas en Piura. Su casa no cuenta con los servicios básicos de saneamiento. 

Camilo goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales. Él se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino  y porcino. Camilo cuenta con clientela establecida en el mercado de su comunidad, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace 5 años y su demanda ha aumentado.

Camilo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado a sus animales para que crezcan y tengan un tamaño adecuado. Así mismo comprará más animales para que su ganado crezca y pueda satisfacer a la nueva demanda.

Camilo es un cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad que ha cancelado sus pagos puntual y responsablemente.
texts.en:
Camilo is 28 years old and lives with his wife and child in the rural section of the District of Las Lomas in Piura. His home does not receive basic sanitation services.

Camilo has good personal and work-related references. He raises and sells sheep and pigs. Camilo has an established customer base at the market in his community. He has been in business for five years and the demand for his animals has increased.

Camilo is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can buy balanced feed for his animals, which will allow them to grow to an adequate size. In addition, he will buy more animals so that his herd of livestock can grow, which will allow him to satisfy this new level of demand.

Camilo is a repeat client of Edpyme Alternativa. He has repaid all of his loans in a timely and responsible manner.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed and to acquire more animals.

loans.name: Rio Vilcanota Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “RIO VILCANOTA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Calca, perteneciente a la provincia D. Calca y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Concepción; ella es casada y tiene 72 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja con su negocio D. restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, prepara también platos como pollo al horno, saltado D. carne y sopas, también venD. cervezas y gaseosas, la socia trabaja desD. las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, pollo, carne y verduras y también para comprar gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor. 


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio D. venta D. artesanía, negocio D. venta D. cds, negocio D. venta D. tienda D. abarrotes, negocio D. venta D. platería.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The loan recipients belong to the village bank "Rio Vilcanota". The bank is located in the district of Calca, which is in the province of Calca and the state of Cusco.

Concepcion, 72, is married and has one son. She works in a restaurant preparing breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She also makes plates like roasted chicken, beef saltado and soups. She sells beers and sodas. She works from 7:00am until 7:00pm, and through this business she has helped her son to get ahead. She wants to grow and improve the restaurants. She requested a loan to buy ingredients like rice, chicken, meet and vegetables, as well as sodas and beer in bulk.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like rice, chicken, meat and vegetables as well as sodas and beers in bulk.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Rosario

texts.es:
Guadalupe pequeña comerciante, con mas de veinte años en las ventas, su negocio lo ha venido diversificando, para lograr el equilibrio en sus ventas. cuando inicio lo hizo con la venta de café, ambulante en un mercado de la capital, luego, luego comienza con la venta de ropa, con dinero que logro atravez del financiamiento, en donde aumento su capital.
De sus cuatro hijos el mayor trabaja,  tres estudian, pero el mas grande la apoya en el mercado a vender ya que la alcandia le dio un tramo, el cual paga impuesto cada mes, pero es de gran sastifacion ya que no se asolea y ni se moja al tener un lugar fijo.
Asi mismo vende su ropa y otras variedades. Con este nuevo financiamiento sera para la compra de cd en musica, peliculas, videos, juegos de nintento, y ropa interior, logrando mejores ventas al ofrecer mas producto.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a small businesswoman with over 20 years experience in sales.  Her business has been diversifying to reach equilibrium in sales.  When she started out she was a street vendor of coffee at a market in the capital.  Then, she started selling clothes with money she got through financing that increased her capital.

Of her four children, the oldest works and the other three are in school.  The oldest helps her sell in the market since the city gave her a space in the market for which she pays a monthly tax but is a great satisfaction because she doesn’t have to be out in the sun nor get wet by having a fixed locale.  She also sells clothes and other items.  

This new loan will be to buy music CDs, DVDs, videos, Nintendo games and underwear to attain better sales by offering more products.

loans.use: to buy CDs and underwear.

loans.name: Edgar Emiliano

texts.es: Edgar Emilliano. de 42 años y tiene dos hijos el se dedica a la venta de madera por mayor, el nos cuenta que lleva ya varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad y gracias a Dios le ha ido bien en su negocio,el aparte de eso se dedica a la venta de flores en sus ratos libres, en esta ocacion esta solicitando este credito para la compra de madera ya que esta conciente de que nececita mas capital para trabajar porque en los ultimos dias ha resivido mucha demanda de sus clientes, el espera que le pueda dar ese apoyo que el nececita para seguir superando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Edgar Emiliano is 42 years old and has two children. He sells wood in bulk. Edgar says that he has been in business for several years and thanks God that he has done well. In addition to this, he sells flowers in his spare time.

On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to buy wood because he is aware that he needs more operating capital. Recently he has experienced more demand from his customers. He hopes to have the support required to continue succeeding in his business.

loans.use: to purchase wood in bulk.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and single with no child with him. He runs a general merchandise store in Lumley near a neighborhood in Freetown.

Samuel has owned this business for three years and sells soft drinks, bottle wined, Heineken and Cody’s in his store. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is the lack of electricity/power supply.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more items like soft drinks, Heineken and bags of rice. Samuel says that the extra income from this loan will help him increase his savings and maximize profit. In the future, he would like to open a supermarket.   .

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks, Heineken and bottled wine.

loans.name: Americo

texts.en: Americo is 36 years old and lives with his partner. He has two daughters who are 3 and 13 years old. Americo works as a taxi driver seven days a week in the city of Cusco. He enjoys his job and takes great pride in the upkeep and care of his taxi. Americo is asking for a 500-dollar loan in order to improve his taxi. Specifically, he plans to purchase new tires and probably a new motor. He is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy new tires and a new motor for his taxi

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elia es madre de familia y tiene un hijo bajo su responsabilidad. 
Desea que su hijo tenga los estudios necesarios para que tenga un mejor futuro, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la inscripción y los uniformes de la escuela. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una clínica de salud.
texts.en:
Rosa Elia is the mother to her family and has one son who she is responsible for.  She hopes that her son will complete the necessary studies so that he has a better future.  This is why she is requesting a loan to be able to pay for his enrollment and the school uniforms.

She plans to pay the loan with a part of the salary she receives from her work in a health clinic.

loans.use: to pay enrollment costs and to buy uniforms.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is 30 years old and married with one child, age 8. She runs a boutique in Tengbeh town, the western part of Freetown. She takes care of two relatives. Her child is currently attending school.   

Salamatu has owned this business for five years and sells a variety of leather slippers at her boutique. She also receives income from her husband. She says that the main challenge to her business is rapid inflation of commodities.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more leather slippers. Salamatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase savings and educate her child. In the future, she would like to expand her business more.

loans.use: to purchase more leather slippers

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 39 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Efraín de 40 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Sofía de 09 y Jairo de 07 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El negocio al que se dedica Norma es la venta de productos naturales, aprovechando que tiene ya hace muchos años una tienda de abarrotes muy conocida en la ciudad de San Francisco, a puesto un stand dentro de esta, donde ofrece a sus clientes todos  sus productos, los cuales son rápidamente comprados, ya que ella sabe muy bien como convencerlos y alentarlos a que se lleven más de un solo producto natural. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que mejor efecto tendrá en sus males, lleva 04 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es convencer a sus clientes sobre la importancia de sus productos, aun así ella sigue adelante muy firme en sus metas. Con el apoyo del crédito solicitará a sus proveedores que la dejen mayor cantidad de productos naturales. Con el tiempo, desea abrir una tienda exclusivamente para sus productos naturales. Este será su 13avo crédito con MFP, espera contar con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir creciendo y en sus aportes se compromete ser puntual como en sus anteriores prestamos, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su banco comunal es muy participativa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos naturales, con lo cual espera implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Norma, 39, is an unassuming, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Efraín, 40, and her two beloved children, Sofía, 9, and Jairo, 7, who are the main motivators of all her efforts.  

Norma’s business is natural products sales.  Taking advantage of the fact that she’s had a well known grocery store in the city of San Francisco for many years she set up a stand inside it where she offers her customers all her product which are bought up quickly because she knows how to convince them and encourage them to take more than one natural product.  What she enjoys the most about her work is advising her customers about the products that will have the best effects on their maladies.  She’s been in business four years and considers the most difficult part convincing her customers about the importance of her products.  Even so, she continues firm in her goals.

With support from the loan, she’ll ask her suppliers to leave a larger volume of natural products.  In time, she’d like to open a store exclusively dedicated to the natural products.

This will be her 13th loan with MFP.  She hopes to have support from lenders to continue growing and commits to be punctual with her installment payments like she’s been in prior loans because she wants to be able to access future loans.  She is very participative in the communal bank.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more natural products that she hopes to use to better stock her sales stand.

loans.use: to buy more natural products to stock her store.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Patricia esta agradecido por su cooperación en los anteriores créditos que a tenido con KIVA.  
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es block, cemento, arena y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar la barda trasera de su vivienda. 
 
Doña Sandra Patricia es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad ha dos hijos que actual mente están estudian y quiere lo mejor para ellos.
Desea darles la seguridad a sus hijos ya que ella trabaja casi todo el día en una fábrica en el departamento de producción. Planea pagar esté crédito con los ingresos de su empleo.
texts.en:
Sandra Patricia is grateful for her previous Kiva loans.  She is asking for a loan now to buy concrete blocks, cement and sand and to pay a person to erect a rear wall at her house.

Sandra Patricia is a single mother and has two children in her care who are currently going to school and she wants the best for them.  She wants to provide security for her children because she works almost all day in a factory in the production department.  She plans to repay the loan with income from her employment.

loans.use: to erect a rear wall.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida tiene 54 años D. edad, es viuda y vive junto a su hija y nieto en la zona rural del distrito D. Chepén. Adelaida es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que goza D. buenas referencias personales.

Adelaida se dedica a la crianza y venta D. cuyes, en su domicilio. Además cría vacas, para vender su leche y realiza labores agrícolas desD. hace 10 años aproximadamente. Actualmente siembra alfalfa para alimentar a sus animales.

Ella solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar y sembrar alfalfa  y así seguir alimentando a su ganado vacuno, para que estos produzcan la leche, que venD. y a sus cuyes para que crezcan adecuadamente y pueda venderlos a mayores precios.

Adelaida es una mujer emprendedora y este préstamo le ayudaría a continuar su negocio D. manera satisfactoria.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 54 years old, widowed, and lives with her daughter and grandson in the rural section of the District of Chepén. She is a hardworking and earnest woman who has good personal references.

Adelaida raises and sells guinea pigs from her home. She also raises cows and sells the milk. Adelaida has engaged in farm work for approximately 10 years. She currently grows alfalfa to feed to her animals.

Adelaida is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy and grow alfalfa. This will allow her to continue feeding her cows so that they can produce milk for her to sell. She will also feed her guinea pigs so that they can grow properly and be sold at better prices.

Adelaida is a hardworking woman and this loan will help continue her business in a satisfactory manner.

loans.use: to purchase and grow alfalfa so that she can feed her animals.

loans.name: 18 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “18 DE SEPTIEMBRE” iniciará su quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maritsa, que en la fotografia es la vestida de guindo. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de abarrotes, peluquería, carnicería, venta de ropa, taller, tienda.

La señora Maritsa  indica que esta hace catorce años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por institución una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de carne que viene trabajando hace 36 años que aprendio de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de carne), las que comprará de la ceja de El Alto y lo comercializará en su tienda de la zona Horizontes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y salud.

En la fotografía no se encuentra en la señora Benigna ya que por cultura no quizo sacarse fotografía.
texts.en:
The “18 de Septiembre” communal bank will start its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Center.  It has 8 members and is led by a governing board headed by Maritsa who is wearing maroon in the photo.  The communal bank members are engaged in a variety of businesses.  Among them are: grocery store, barber shop, butcher shop, clothing sales, workshop and store.

Maritsa indicates that she’s been working with Pro Mujer for 14 years having joined thanks to a promoter.  Currently, she has a butcher shop that she’s been running for 36 years; she learned from her family.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital (meat purchase).  She will buy it in La Ceja in El Alto and will sell it in her store in the Horizontes zone.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family as best she can because she’s married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health services.

Benigna did not want to have her picture taken because of cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposa y 3 hijos en una comunidad en vías de desarrollo perteneciente a la provincia de Morropón en Piura.

Cesar se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas, desde hace 2 años. Esta labor la realiza en su comunidad y en los centros poblados alrededor de esta. Cesar cuenta con clientela establecida y este negocio le ha traído ganancias que le han  permitido ir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para invertir en su negocio, comprando fruta al contado. Además realizará algunos arreglos al interior de su casa.

Este préstamo le sería de gran ayuda y Cesar estaría muy agradecido de concedérselo.
texts.en:
Cesar is 49 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a developing community in Morropón Province in Piura.

He has been buying and selling fruits for two years. Cesar works in his community and in the surrounding areas. He has an established customer base and the income generated from his business enables him to improve his quality of life.

Cesar is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can invest in his business. He plans to buy fruit and pay with cash. In addition, he plans to make a few repairs to the interior of his house. This loan will be a great help and Cesar is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy fruit and to make a few home repairs.

loans.name: Maria Etelvina

texts.es:
Etelvina tiene 46 años de edad y  es una  madre de familia que vive en el distrito de Oyotún  en Chiclayo. Etelvina goza de buenas referencias por ser una persona dedicada a sus hijos y esposo.

Etelvina cuenta con una bodega en la que vende artículos de primera necesidad. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años, lo que le ha dado experiencia y clientela. Además, lo ha desarrollado de tal manera que su bodega es una de las más surtidas de su comunidad.

Etelvina desea seguir creciendo  en su negocio  y por eso ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles, para invertir en él.

Etelvina comprará los artículos que tienen mayor demanda y surtirá su negocio con productos nuevos y de mejor calidad. Además,  Etelvina hará algunas instalaciones para mejorar el aspecto de su bodega.

Esta inversión le dará la oportunidad de aumentar su capital para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Ella estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el crédito.
texts.en:
Etelvina is a 46-year-old mother who lives in the District of Oyotún in Chiclayo. She has good references who indicate that she is dedicated to her husband and children.

Etelvina has a general store where she sells basic necessities. This business has been in operation for 10 years and has provided her with experience and a customer base. In addition, the development of her business has allowed her to have one of the best-stocked stores in her community.

Etelvina wants to continue growing her business, so she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3000 PEN so that she can invest in it. She will buy merchandise that is in great demand so that she can restock her store with products that are newer and of the best quality. In addition, she will make a few improvements to improve the appearance of her store.

This investment will give her the opportunity to increase her capital so that she can improve her family’s quality of life. She would be very grateful if she were to receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 57 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha luchado por sobresalir, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Emilio de 55 años y su querida hija menor Yoisela de 17 años, a quien brindan todo su apoyo. El restaurante de Reyna es el más concurrido del barrio “Vista Alegre” de la ciudad de San Francisco, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su restaurante para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara como: arroz con pollo, tallarin, lomo saltado, entre otros platos. Ella es una cocinera muy buena, aprendió de los secretos de su madre y desde entonces le nació el amor por la cocina. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y poner el toque del sabor es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 28 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más dificultoso es cuando sus clientes se acumulan y le falta la mano para poder atender a todos. Reyna espera beneficiarse con el crédito ya que desea renovar sus utensilios que están deteriorados por nuevos porque desea brindar una buena atención a sus asiduos comensales. Y Más adelante espera mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante. Es será su 15avo crédito de Reyna con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y  por ello espera contar con el mismo apoyo de los financistas ya que gracias al apoyo de ellos trata de mejorar su condición de vida. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará utensilios nuevos.
texts.en:
Reyna, 57, is a woman who has always struggled to get ahead in life.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Emilio, 55, and her beloved younger daughter, Yoisela, 17, that they give all their support to.  

Reyna’s restaurant is located in the crowded “Vista Alegre” neighborhood in the city of San Francisco.  Every day customers schedule themselves to enjoy the delicious meals she prepares in her restaurant like: rice with chicken, noodles, ‘lomo saltado’ (dish consisting of strips of sirloin marinated in vinegar, soy sauce and spices, then stir fried with red onions, parsley and tomatoes. It is traditionally served over white rice with homemade French fries that look more like potato wedges), among other dishes.  She’s a very good cook having learned her mother’s secrets and loving cooking since then.  What she most likes about her work is cooking and adding a touch of flavor which she does with much dedication.  She’s been in this line of work for 28 years and thinks that it's most problematic when customers crowd in and she lacks sufficient hands to tend to all of them.

Reyna hopes to benefit from the loan because she wants to exchange her deteriorated kitchen utensils for new ones because she wants to provide better attention to her demanding customers.

This will be her 15th loan with MFP.  She has always been very punctual with her payments and because of this hopes to once again enjoy the same level of support she’s had from lenders because thanks to their support she tries to improve her living conditions.  

She is a very responsible member of the communal bank which makes her very well liked.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy new kitchen utensils.

loans.use: to buy new utensils.

loans.name: San Antonio De Jicamarca Group

texts.es: Viviana es integrante de la Nueva Alcancía Comunal “San Antonio de Jicamarca” donde la conforman 08 personas, en la cual ella tiene el cargo de tesorera. Viviana es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos que en la actualidad todavía dependen de ella y de conyugue, Viviana  lleva más de 12 años dedica a la crianza de cerdos, contando hasta el momento con 10 chanchos y 20 lechones, esta   actividad que nació a raíz de que su esposo no contaba con un trabajo estable ya que se dedica a la labranza, es así como Viviana toma la decisión de  ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar  y con la educación de sus menores hijos. Con el préstamo que solicito piensa comprar alimentos para sus cerdos (comida balanceada). A futuro a Viviana le gustaría comprarse un carro para que ella pueda ir a comprar los alimentos ya que el flete le sale muy caro. La Nueva Alcancía Comunal “San Antonio de Jicamarca” están agradecidos y comprometidos con el Programa-Prosperidad.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the Nueva Alcancía communal bank “San Antonio de Jicamarca” which is made up of eight people and where she is the treasurer.  Viviana is very friendly and has four children who all still depend on her and her husband.  Viviana has worked for more than 12 years raising pigs and at the moment has 10 pigs and 20 piglets.  This work began because her husband didn’t have a stable job as he works in agriculture.  This is why Viviana decided to help her partner with the household expenses and raising their young children.  

With the loan she is requesting she plans to buy feed for her pigs (balanced food).  In the future Viviana would like to buy herself a car so that she could go to buy the feed for her pigs as delivery is very expensive.  The Nueva Alcancía communal bank “San Antonio de Jicamarca” members are thankful and committed to the Programa-Prosperidad (Prosperity Program).

loans.use: to buy balanced feed (for pigs).

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan tiene 24 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo menor que depende de él. Juan y su familia viven en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, en una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 100 familias. 

Juan se dedica, desde hace 4 años, a la crianza y comercialización de animales. Él realiza esta actividad en su domicilio y la experiencia de sus padres le ha enseñado a desarrollar su negocio adecuadamente, lo que le ha llevado a contar con clientela fija. Adicionalmente, Juan comercializa arroz a los pobladores de su zona.

El esfuerzo en su trabajo ha permitido que Juan construya de a pocos su casa. Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles, para comprar planchas y viguetas para terminar el techado de su casa. Este préstamo le sería de gran ayuda y es por ello que estaría muy agradecido  de concedérselo.
texts.en:
Juan is 24 years old, married, and has a young child who is dependent on him. He and his family live in a rural area in the District of Lambayeque. This small community has approximately 100 families.

For the past four years, Juan has been raising and selling animals. He conducts his business at home. Juan developed his business properly as a result of watching the experience of his parents. He now has an established customer base. In addition, he sells rice to the local villagers.

The efforts through his work have enabled him to gradually build his house. Juan is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can buy metal sheets and beams to complete the roof of his house. This loan will be of great help, which is why he is very grateful.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets and beams so that he can finish the roof of his house.

loans.name: Yolanda Zulema

texts.es:
Yolanda Zulema tiene 42 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos , en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Yolanda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es seguir invirtiendo en este negocio para tener mas ingresos y ayudar a los hijos.

Le gusta cocinar en familia y bailar en las fiestas.
texts.en:
Yolanda Zulema is 42 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “El Divino Niño” (The Divine Child) meet in the neighborhood of Estero Lindo, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Yolanda is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She buys her products at the AGRIPAC Commercial Center and sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

The loan she is requesting will be used for planting corn and rice. She will buy seeds and composts for her corn and rice crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include diseases that could impact her crops and the lack of money to pay for more workers. Her dream is to continue investing in her business so that she can have more income and support her children.

Yolanda enjoys cooking for her family and dancing at parties.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost for planting corn and rice.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca tiene su negocio que es la venta de productos varios. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de molino. Ella tiene que empezar su labor desde muy temprano desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde pues llegan a moler maíz, cacao, carne, cuajada, queso, trigo  entre otros. El financiamiento es para la compra de motores y además proporcionarle mantenimiento a algunos motores que necesita. Ella sueña con agrandar su negocio cada día más.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca has a business selling various products. She also has more than 17 years of experience providing milling services. Juana begins her work very early at 5am and continues through 6pm. She grinds corn and cacao, and also sells curds, cheese, wheat and other products.

This loan will be used to buy motors and to pay for maintenance of a few motors that she already owns. Her dream is to expand her business each day.

loans.use: to purchase motors for her grain mills and to pay for maintenance of the existing motors.

loans.name: Andres Avelino

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su familia en casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Chepén en La Libertad. Goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales por ser una persona empeñosa en la actividad que realiza.

Andrés se dedica a la pesca y venta de pescados de manera ambulatoria, desde hace 17 años, esto le ha dado gran experiencia y clientela. Su trabajo le ha permitido desarrollarse económicamente y desea seguir invirtiendo en él.

Andrés solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles  para darle mantenimiento a sus mallas  y comprar otros accesorios de pesca que necesita para seguir desarrollando su labor adecuadamente. Además, parte del crédito será destinado al mantenimiento de su moto lineal la cual utiliza para transportar sus productos.

Esta inversión le ayudará a aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Andres is 48 years old. He lives with his family in their own home,  ​​located in the district of Chepén in La Libertad. He has good personal and professional references because he is a person committed to his work. 

Andres has been fishing and selling fish in the streets for 17 years, which has given him a lot of experience and a good client base. His work has allowed him to improve his financial position and he would like to continue investing in it.

Andres is requesting Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1000 soles to repair his nets and buy other fishing accessories he needs to further develop his work properly. In addition, part of the loan will go to pay for the maintenance of the motorbike he uses to transport his products. 

This investment will help him increase his revenue and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his nets and buy fishing accessories.

loans.name: Santos Rosas De Lima

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Santos le está haciendo falta la losa de concreto en dos cuarto. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es cemento, arena, varilla, madera y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poner el techo de concreto porque es mas duradero, seguro y prevenir enfermedades a su esposa e hijos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una empresa como guardia de seguridad. Es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos’ house is lacking concrete roofing in two rooms.  He’s asking for the loan to be able to buy the material, which is cement, sand, iron rods and lumber and to pay the person who will do the improvement.

He wants to improve his family’s quality of life and install concrete roofing because it lasts longer, is safer and it helps prevent his wife’s and children’s illnesses.

He plans to repay the loan with part of the salary he earns working as a security guard at a firm.  This is his family’s source of income.

loans.use: to install concrete roofing.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 34 years old, married and has 4 children, 6-19 years of age. He lives in his own permanent house in Karuguuza, Uganda. 

For 13 years, Fred has been dealing in the carpentry and joinery business and from this he has been able to build a house and buy land. He faces a challenge of high timber costs and high rate of inflation but hopes to set up a big workshop. Fred intends to use the loan to buy timber for his carpentry.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro vive al sur de la  ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 18 años; allí se dedica a la confección de ropa de maternidad, actividad que inició hace 4 años cuando vendía en un almacén de insumos para la confección y de allí le nació la idea de independizarse y emprender su propia aventura de negocios, instalándose en un local, el cual es atendido por su esposo,  desde hace más de un año, mientras Socorro se capacitó en la actividad de modistería y sastrería en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “Sena”,  institución que cumple la función de invertir en el desarrollo social y técnico de los trabajadores colombianos, con Formación Profesional Integral gratuita, para lograr la incorporación y el desarrollo de las personas en actividades productivas que contribuyan al desarrollo social, económico y tecnológico del país. 
Así es que una vez aprendió  este oficio, se enfocó en la línea de maternidad que hasta hoy también comercializa en su local.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materias primas e insumos para confeccionar, pues está sacando nuevas colecciones para impactar a su clientela. 
Su meta es consolidar su almacén ubicado en la zona norte de la ciudad y que este se convierta a su vez en una fuente de ingreso y empleo para su familia.  Su máximo desafío es lograr su posicionamiento en el mercado, pues es muy fuerte la competencia aunque sus productos son de muy buena calidad y por eso su operación es de alto costo. Mientras cumple sus sueños maneja una rentabilidad no inferior al 48% que cada día se esfuerza por que esta sea estable y superarla.
texts.en:
Socorro lives to the south of the city of Barranquilla, with her husband and two children, aged 14 and 18. She makes maternity clothes, an activity she began 4 years ago when she was working as a sales assistant in a shop selling dressmaking supplies. From there was born the idea of becoming independent and starting her own business venture. She installed herself in a location, which her husband staffed for over a year while Socorro trained in design and sewing with the National Learning Service. The National Learning Service is an institution which invests in the social and technical skills development of the Colombian workforce, providing free professional training courses to support people's development in activities which contribute to the social, economic and technological development of the country.

Once she had learned her trade this way, Socorro focused on the line of maternity wear that she still sells in her shop today. Her Kiva loan is the first finance she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with it she will buy materials and supplies for dressmaking, because she is bringing out new collections to please her customers. Her aim is to consolidate her store in the north of the city, and to build it up over time into a source of income and employment for her family. Her greatest challenge is securing her position in the market, because the competition is stiff and, because her clothes are of very good quality, her costs are high. While she works to achieve her dreams she is working at a profit of no less than 48%, and every day she works to ensure this is stable and even to improve on it.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for dressmaking.

loans.name: Erminia

texts.es:
Erminia es una mujer alegre y trabajadora de 40 años de edad, es madre de familia y vive en casa propia con sus 3 hijos y esposo, que la apoya en sus actividades. Erminia vive en una comunidad pequeña y rural del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. No cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

Erminia se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería. Ella cosecha limón y cría ovinos para luego comercializarlos. Erminia cuenta con un ganado numeroso (35 ovejas) y su esposo la ayuda a manejarlo. Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 5 años.

Erminia solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de limón (fertilizantes) y para comprar alimento balanceado a sus ovinos.

Erminia es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación y este crédito le daría la oportunidad de seguir desarrollando su negocio adecuadamente
texts.en:
Erminia is a cheerful and hardworking woman of 40 years old. She is the mother of a family and lives in her own house with her 3 children and her husband, who supports her in her work. Erminia lives in a small rural community in the district of Tambogrande – Piura, which does not have access to all the basic utilities.

Erminia dedicates herself to farming and raising livestock. She harvests lemons and raises sheep, which she later sells. Erminia has a large flock of 36 sheep, and her husband helps her to look after them. She has been doing this for over 5 years. 

Erminia is seeking a loan of 1000 Soles from [the field partner] Edpyme Alternativa, in order to maintain her lemon crop with fertilizers and to buy feed for her sheep.

Erminia has a great desire to improve her situation, and this loan will give her the opportunity to continue developing her business.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Saidu's Group

texts.en:
The five teachers in this group work at a secondary school in the township of Kabala. The school was founded in 2001 by the Baptist Mission to improve education in the community. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. 

This is the first loan that teachers of this school have received from SMT/Kiva lenders. The group has requested for a loan of SLL 5,000,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers are in a better position to buy or invest in something that their mere salary cannot let them do.

Saidu is the leader of the group. Saidu is 37 years old, is married and has three children. Saidu has requested this loan in order to invest part in his business and also to buy household equipment/furniture.

loans.use: to invest part in the business and to use the remainder to buy household equipment/furniture.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es: Serafina tiene 47 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Fabián de 44 años y sus 02 hijos menores, Dina de 21 y  Tabita de 15 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Serafina es una mujer de muchas responsabilidades que cumplir, por ello se despierta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos para los miembros de su familia para luego dirigirse a abrir las puertas de su negocio en espera de sus primeros consumidores. La tienda de abarrotes de Serafina es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse y la ultima en cerrarse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dialogar con sus vecinos, lleva 08 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, ya que tiene que atender de corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado comprará mas provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementar el stock de sus productos. Mas adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el almacén principal de su barrio. Este será su segundo crédito y necesita el apoyo de todos ustedes para llevar consigo  su propósito, además se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por ser parte de su banco comunal. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará mas mercadería como sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas y entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Serafina is 47 years old.  She’s a kind, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Fabián, 44, and their two minor children, Dina, 21 and Tabita, 15, who are the main motivators of all her efforts.

Serafina is a woman with lots of responsibilities to shoulder.  Because of this she rises early to prepare meals for her family and then head over to open up her store awaiting her first customers.  

Serafina’s grocery store is one of the most popular in the neighborhood.  Her great charisma and the kindness with which she treats the customers have made hers the preferred one among her neighbors who don’t hesitate to do their shopping starting very early because they know hers is the first store to open and the last to close.  What she most likes about her work is chatting with her neighbors.  She’s been in this line of work for 8 years and considers the most difficult part having to stay inside the store all day because she has to stay open non-stop all day if she doesn’t want her sales to drop.

With support from the requested loan she will buy more merchandise for her grocery store to increase stock.  Later on, she hopes that business will grow and turn into the main store in her neighborhood.

This will be her second loan and she needs support from all of you to reach her objective.  In addition, she commits to repay her loan punctually and is grateful for being part of her communal bank.  She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy merchandise like sacks of rice, sugar, milk, noodles and canned goods, among others.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, milk, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, tiene 50 años, es una mujer  alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eloy de 50 años y sus 02 menores hijos William de 20 y Yaneth de 14años, a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. María una mujer de ardua labor se esmera a diario por dar lo mejor a sus 02 queridos hijos. En la ciudad de San Francisco, si uno desea comprar unos zapatos o sandalias acorde a su talla o que sean novedosas, sus clientes no dudan en acudir a la tienda de María. Sus novedosos modelos traídos por ella misma desde la ciudad de Lima, marcan una gran diferencia con la mercadería de la competencia, lo cual ha hecho que su negocio sea muy concurrido. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los zapatos que mejor les queden, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar las lluvias intermitentes que a veces suelen llover sin cesar todo el día y factor a ello sus ventas del día suelen bajar. Menciona que el gasto de educación de sus menores hijos es más grande, razón por la cual acude a los prestamos que la institución MFP facilita, con el dinero obtenido viajará a la capital a comprar más mercaderías que abastezcas su puesto de ventas  y con el resto del dinero pagará la pensión de estudios de sus adorados hijos. Con el tiempo, desea poner otro negocio, esta vez incursionaría en la comida, ya que ha visto que es una buena fuente de ingresos. Este será su séptimo crédito con MFP y espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda comprar la mercadería que le hace falta y con ello poder tener más ganancias. Agradece a las socias de su banco comunal por la responsabilidad que tienen. Con los 3,000 mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más zapatos y sandalias de la ciudad de Lima, para aumentar el stock que tiene en su tienda.
texts.en:
María is from the city of San Francisco.  She’s 50 years old.  She’s a cheerful, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Eloy, 50, and their two minor children, William, 20, and Yaneth, 14, that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.

María is a hard worker who tries daily to give her best to her two beloved children.  In the city of San Francisco, if one wants to buy a pair of shoes or sandals in one’s size that are stylish customers don’t hesitate to go to María’s store.  Her novel styles brought by herself from the city of Lima stand out among the competition which has made her store quite popular.  What she enjoys the most about her work is advising her customers about which shoes best suit them.  She’s been in business for 10 years and the most difficult part is putting up with the intermittent rain storms which sometimes last all day and cause her sales to drop.

She mentions that educational costs for her minor children are higher and this is why she’s calling on MFP for a loan.  With the money she gets she’ll travel to the capital to buy more merchandise to stock her sales stand and will use the remaining funds to pay for her beloved children’s monthly tuition.  In time, she’d like to start a new business; she’ll go into food sales, since she’s noticed that this is a good source of income.

This will be her 7th loan with MFP and she hopes to get support from all of you to be able to buy the merchandise she needs to have more profits.  She thanks her fellow communal bank members for the responsibility they have.  She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy more shoes and sandals in the city of Lima to increase the stock she has on hand at her store.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Remigio

texts.es:
Remigio tiene 36 años de edad, es padre de 2 niños y esta felizmente casado. Remigio y su familia viven en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, en una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 200 familias.

Desde hace 5 años, Remigio se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco de recorriendo  las viviendas de su comunidad y alrededores (en su mototaxi) y también desde su domicilio. Remigio conoce a la perfección su actividad y cuenta con clientela establecida. 

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de pescado e incursionar en la crianza de aves de corral. Desea comprar aves medianas para engorde y el alimento balanceado que la crianza de estas requiere. Además hará unas pequeñas reparaciones a su mototaxi.

Remigio es un comerciante emprendedor y cliente antiguo de nuestra institución. Goza de buenas referencias personales y crediticias.
texts.en:
Remigio is 36 years old. He is the father of 2 children and is happliy married. Remigio and his family live in a rural area in the Lambayeque district, in a small community of approximately 200 families.

For the past 5 years, Remigio has sold fresh fish round the houses of his community and its environs, from his mototaxi, as well as from home. Remigio knows his business well and has an established customer base.

He is seeking a loan of 2000 Soles from [the field partner] Edpyme Alternativa, so he can buy a greater quantity of fish and also to get into raising poultry. He wants to buy half-grown birds to fatten up, and the balanced poultry-feed that the birds will require. He would aslo like to make minor repairs to his mototaxi. 

Remingio is an enterprising businessman and a long-time client of the field partner. He comes with good references, both personally and in terms of his credit-worthiness.

loans.use: To buy fish and poultry.

loans.name: Esmelda

texts.es:
Esmelda tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera pero tiene 2 sobrinas que dependen de ella. Vive en casa de su padre, un hombre que a pesar de sus años, sigue realizando labores de cultivo en su propia parcela. Esta familia vive en una comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de Sullana. Y su vivienda no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

Esmelda es una mujer trabajadora, dedicada a su familia que desde hace 3 años trabaja vendiendo abarrotes (arroz, aceite, azúcar, etc.) y bebidas en una pequeña bodega en el interior de su hogar. Además,  con la ayuda de sus sobrinas, Esmelda  cría aves de corral  que luego comercializa a los pobladores de su zona y en el mercado de la localidad.

Esmelda solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar abarrotes y surtir su bodega. Así como alimento balanceado para sus aves. Este crédito le permitirá continuar desarrollando sus actividades y obtener mayores ganancias que le darán una mejor calidad de vida.

Esmelda tiene muchos deseos de superarse personal y laboralmente.
texts.en:
Esmelda is 46 years old. She is single but has 2 cousins who depend on her. She lives in her father's house, a man who continues to work and cultivate his land in spite of his age. The family lives in a rural community in the Sullana district. Their home does not have all the basic utilities.

Esmelda is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family. For the past 3 years she has worked selling groceries (rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc) and drinks in a little store inside her home. In addition, with the help of her cousins, Esmelda raises poultry which she later sells to people in her neighbourhood and in the local market.

Esmelda is seeking a loan of 1000 soles from [the field partner] Edpyme Alternativa, to buy groceries to supply her store and to buy balanced feed for her poultry. this loan will enable her to continue developing her business activities and to obtain greater earnings, which will give her a better quality of life. Esmeralda has a great desire to improve herself personally and professionally.

loans.use: To buy groceries and poultry-feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Eufemia Gregoria

texts.es: Doña Eufemia Gregoria tiene 51 años es madre. Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en su propio negocio que sería la venta de mercadería en general, tiene más de 27 años en este negocio en donde conoce muy bien las diferentes calidades de productos que ofrece y a sus clientes. Sale todos los días a ofrecer productos como mochilas, sabanas, bolsos, perfumes, tratamientos, calzado y otros productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de estos prodcutos que les muestra a sus clientes todos los dias ya que tiene una gran variedad de encargos.  Su sueño es ver crecer a su hijo y seguirle proporcionando apoyando con el estudio. Con el préstamo solicitado comprara la materia prima que necesita.
texts.en: Doña Eufemia Gregoria is 51 years old, and a mother. When she was very young, she started her own business, which would be the sale of merchandise in general. She has now had more than 27 years in this business and well knows the quality of the products she offers her customers. She goes out every day to sell products such as rucksacks, sheets, handbags, perfumes, toiletries, socks and other goods. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of these products, as having them will show to her clients that she has a large variety of merchandise. Her dream is to see her son grow up and to continue supporting him in his education. With the loan she will buy the raw material needed.

loans.use: to buy rucksacks, sheets, handbags, perfumes, toiletries, socks and other products.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel Antonio es un hombre trabajor, con deseo de superacion para el bienestar de su familia. su negocio es una pulperia en donde tambien, ha invertido en verduras para aumentar su capital, beneficiandose con las ganancias, el cual son para pagos basicos de agua, luz, estudios para sus hijos.
Ha tenido muchas dificultades, una grande es la muerte de mi bebe reciennacida, el robo de su caballo que era su medio de transporte. Su familia esta logrando el equilibrio emocional y economico, asi como poder dar buena atencion  a los clientes siendo su medio de subsistir con su pequeño negocio.
Don Manuel es atraves de los pretamos en Afodenic que se ah ayudado, para aumentar sus de productos, en estos cinco ciclos.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara granos basicos en quintal de arroz, azucar, maiz, frijoles, bidon de aceite, caja de jabon, papel higienico, sopas marucha, sopa maggi, ase, golosinas, gaseosas. Con el objetivo de poder mantener su clientela al ofertar una variedad de productos, siendo los de mayor consumo.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio is a hard working man with a strong drive to improve his family’s wellbeing.  His business is a grocery store where he’s also invested in vegetables to increase capital benefitting from the profits which are used to cover basic payments like water, electricity and his children’s schooling.

He has had many difficulties a huge one being the death of his newborn daughter and the theft of a horse that was his means of transportation.  His family is reaching emotional and economic stability as well as being able to provide good service to customers since this small business is their means of support.

Manuel has helped himself to increase products through five cycles of Afodenic loans.  He will use this new loan to buy basic grains by the quintal: rice, sugar, corn and beans and large jugs of oil, a case of soap, toilet paper, Maruchan soups, Maggi soups, Ace, snacks and soft drinks with the goal in mind of keeping his clientele by offering a variety of products which are most consumed.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Katia Pamela

texts.es:
Katia tiene  21 años de edad, es una joven soltera sin carga familiar. Vive con su hermano, dedicado a la agricultura y su madre que trabaja en una fábrica de pota. Katia vive en el distrito de Bernal en Sechura. En una comunidad mediana en vías de desarrollo.

Katia se dedica a la producción y comercialización de harina y chicha de Jora (maíz) y pequeños platos de comida. Además,  vende víveres, tubérculos (papa, camote, yuca)  y carnes. Esta actividad la realiza en  su propio domicilio, desde hace 3 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su madre. El negocio de Katia tiene clientela fidelizada y es muy conocido en la zona.

Ella solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar maíz para la preparación de la harina y chicha de Jora, además de otros insumos para la preparación de sus platos de comida. Así mismo, desea renovar sus vajillas. Esto le permitirá seguir ofreciendo buenos productos y dar una mejor calidad de servicio, lo que le dará mayores ingresos para desarrollarse  íntegramente. 

Katia,  posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su negocio, muestra rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Katia is 21. She is a single young woman without a family burden. She lives with her brother, who works in agriculture, and her mother, who works in a saucepan factory. Katia lives in the district of Bernal in Sechura, in a medium-sized developing community.

Katia makes and sells flour and Chicha de Jora [a traditional corn-based liquor], and finger food. On top of this, she also sells groceries, tubers (potato, sweet potato, yucca) and meats. She does this in her own home, and has had this business for three years. Her mother helps her. Katia's business has a loyal customer base and is very well-known in the zone.

She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of corn for making flour and Chicha de Jora. It will also be used to purchase other tools for making her food. She also wants to refresh her dishware.  This will allow her to continue offering good products and a higher quality of service. This will mean better income for her overall development.

Katia has very good personal and work references. Her business demonstrates profitability.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for food, and dishes.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: Feliciana, natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, tiene 52 años, es viuda y madre de 04 hijos que están en etapa escolar. Residen en el poblado de Triboline donde tienen su propia casa construida de material rustico. Feliciana es padre y madre para sus hijos, ella esta pendiente de todas las necesidades de sus queridos hijos. Feliciana supo sobre salir a base de mucho esfuerzo y perseverancia ante la falta de su amado esposo. Hoy trabaja tranquila y con la frente bien en alta y lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos. Feliciana es campesina y labra sus tierras en donde cultiva cacao y café, viene realizando esta actividad hace 25 años con mucho esmero y laboriosidad,  por que gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas ella cubre los gastos educativos de sus hijos. Feliciana cuenta con espacios de terreno sin cultivar, lo cual necesariamente necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar acabo sus actividades programadas, por tanto  tiene pensado sembrar sus tierras con plantas de café, pero no cuenta con dinero suficiente por ello acude a los créditos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a progresar. Para el bien de su trabajo e hijos se encomienda a dios para que la tenga de buena salud. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP y espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con los 500 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará plantas de café.
texts.en:
Feliciana is from the city of San Francisco.  She’s 52 years old, a widow and mother of four children who are school age.  They live in the community of Triboline where they have their house made out of insubstantial building materials.  Feliciana is both father and mother to her children.  She is watchful of all their needs.

Feliciana knew how to get ahead based on much effort and perseverance despite the loss of her beloved husband.  Today, she works at peace and with her head held very high and fights to move her children ahead.

Feliciana is a farmer working her fields where she grows coffee and cocoa beans.  She’s been working in this occupation for 25 years with much dedication and attention because thanks to the fruits her plants produce she’s able to cover the educational costs of her children.

Feliciana has some uncultivated fields but necessarily needs help from the financial institution to carry out her programmed activities.  She plans to plant coffee there but lacks enough money to do so and this is why she’s calling upon the loans that MFP grants to low resource people who want to progress.  

For the wellbeing of her work and of her children she puts herself in God’s hands so that she’ll have good health.  This will be her 12th loan with MFP.  She hopes for help from all of you to continue working.  She will use the requested 500 new soles to buy coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy more coffee plants.

loans.name: Patricia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia es soltera, vive con sus padres los cuales le ayudan a desarrollar su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (azúcar, leche, fideos, etc.)  y todo tipo de verduras; ella empezó con un pequeño puesto vendiendo verduras y fue creciendo hasta abrir su propia tienda de abarrotes.
Patricia va a invertir el crédito en la compra de productos y verduras para su tienda de abarrotes; su sueño de patricia es poder ampliar mucho más su negocio y terminar de construir su casa. Ella está muy agradecida con el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Patricia is single and she lives with her parents, who help her carrying out her shop. She runs a grocery store (selling sugar, milk, noodles, etcetera) and every kind of vegetables. She stared selling vegetables in a small stall, and she keep on growing until she was able to open her own grocery store.

Patricia will invest the loan in the purchase of products and vegetables for her grocery store. Her dream is to increase her activity and finish building her house. She is very grateful for the loan she is being granted.

loans.use: To buy products such as sugar, milk, nodles and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for making chicha; and barnyard birds.

loans.name: Milena Yasmina

texts.es: La señora Milena se dedica a vender mercadería en general. Ella tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, sus esfuerzos de sacar a sus hijos adelante es su prioridad  por lo que fue su motivación con este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante y su vivienda. Ella inicio este negocio debido a la necesidad de mantenerse porque buscaba trabajo y no encontraba, y con mucho sacrificio tenía que encontrar la forma de mejorar su condición. Por lo que así logro dedicarse obteniendo muy buenos resultados.
